I see a lot of people harshly judging this anime. I understand why people might hate it. But today I am here to tell you exactly why Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni is the best comedy anime this year if not the best of these past 4 years.
Let me set something straight :
This anime is the literal apex of ironic comedy anime.
You heard me. Ironic comedy. If you don't like ironic comedy or you are one of those people who actually care about serious, in-depth stories, this is definitely not an anime for you. Now allow me to elucidate on how this anime perfectlyaccomplishes exactly what it is intended to accomplish. 


To begin, this anime is full of clichés. If you could not tell this anime was a cliché filled anime from the title, it will be pretty apparent within the first episode. However, the amount of immense clichés in this anime is a complete parodies of other animes. It parodies terrible anime is such a great way that it appears to be a terrible anime. Its crazy overpowered MC, the instant harem that he gets, the cliché outfit, and it's use of "friendship and teamwork" to overcome tough situations instead of the MCs insane overpowered abilities. This is just a mocking of all the ridiculous clichés used in all the regurgitation animes.


However, even for being an ironic comedy anime, it still shines through story wise. Beyond the clichés, it takes original turns throughout the story that one would not even nearly expect even from a regular, serious fantasy cliché anime. Such as actually progressing the harem and the characters. Characters in typical harem animes normally always fit into the -dere categories. However in this anime, the expected "tsundere" characters do not vehemently deny loving the MC. Take Yumina for example. She is expected to be  a Kuudere(character with no fuckin personality at all but underlying emotions that are unspoken) but she isn't. She likes Touya, but she also respects him enough to be around other women. She also understands that polygamy exists in the world, so she is fine with that. She gets jealous, but she also understands that a lot of the clichéd misunderstandings are just misunderstandings and puts her faith in Touya. Now lets take Touya into account. His clichés are : super overpowered, super oblivious, stupid nice to everyone, and shy when it comes to relationships and shit. However, he is a deadass pervert. He also has confidence in himself, and slight arrogance. He realizes how overpowered he can be but he does not strive for more power. These round characters are really revealing of the talent of the writers, masked behind a veil of overused clichés to blind the audience. It is a great work of art for being a very good parody of terrible art. 


Onto everything else, the art was pretty good. The sounds were regular cliché cutesy sound effects. The story was, beyond the clichés, actually pretty decent. The uniqueness of magic and null magic, and the capacity it was taken to was pretty cool. You'd expect some fucking massive kamehameha blast explosion shit to take down one of the most powerful beings on the planet, but instead he takes it down using basically the youtube autoreplay button to make a snake wrapped turtle trip over and over for 7 hours. It's ridiculous simplicity makes everything funny, but also original in the fact that it isn't overly explosive and flashy to draw attention. It kind of reminds me of one punch man where the main character is so overpowered that he uses regular lame moves to get the job done.


If you enjoy ironic parody comedy, or just something light in contrast to all the serious dark tryhard animes, I believe that you will love this ironic masterpiece of an anime.

I joined this site to write a review since others have thrashed this pretty horribly. To begin with this anime is based off of a light novel. So in order to get to some sort of ending by the end of the season a lot of content is missing. So if you want character development and other stories I really suggest reading the light novel. I have bought the novel and fully enjoy it. There is so much more to the story that the novel opens up that it makes the series more interesting. As for the anime I think they looked to highlight themain stories and create something to draw people into the novel. I know it sucks they removed a lot of content, but this seems to be a tend going on in anime. I have seen a lot of new anime series that are based off of popular novels over the pass few seasons. Unfortunately most of these rarely see another season since they are primarily a way to promote the novel. And since the anime gets thrashed for lack of content it usually does not do well enough to merit another season. so if you like this kind of genre but feel the story is lacking try the novel out.

Instead it focuses on the characters' interaction with each other. It knows fully that you'd probably be watching this anime for the harem and romance, and that's where they excel anddoesn't give you any bullshit plot that a lot of harem anime do.\n\n
So, again, this anime is just a pure ball of fun, and if you're tired of watching serious anime this might just be the way to unwind from all the bullshit and just have nice trip through harem land.

Do you like harems? Do you love overpowered characters? Do you like girls that are not dense? Because that's all you are going to find here. This anime is generic as it can possibly can get, and the show it's aware of it. It never tries to be serious, because it wouldn't work. But don't get me wrong, this show is extremely enjoyable if you like harems. 
The best way of describing this anime is like eating an ice cream. You know it's bad for you, you know it's all sugar, you know you'll end up wanting more once you finish it, yet you stilleat it once in a while because it's so delicious. It's perfect for watching after a long day and you just don't want to deal with any drama, suffering or sadness. You just watch it and enjoy it.\n
Don't let other people tell you that watching this is a waste of time, in tastes nothing is written. After all, these are cartoons. You watch them for enjoyment.

Here comes dat boi with another short review in response to all the haters.
I went into this anime because I like stories that make the MC come from "our" world and then they get transferred to a fantasy world but with some sort of advantage that makes them better than most people, like Overlord. 
The anime doesn't have a complicated and deep storyline, but who says that's a bad thing? Coming to an anime like this and criticizing it for the story is like going to a football game to watch the romance.
The story's basically about a guy named Touya who dies, gets a giantboost to his overall traits by "God" along with his smartphone, and then gets transferred to this fantasy world where he has now uses his giant advantages to be a good Samaritan. He meets harem girls, fights badies in the name of justice, and even acts like a normal human being unlike most harem protagonists.\n\n
The reason I liked this anime so much is because the MC isn't a total wimp and the harem thing actually has a conclusion, not a standstill like ever other cliche harem anime out there does. Touya doesn't just fidget an entire episode when a girl walks past him, and even better, he isn't a weakling that stands on the sidelines powerless to stop every little bad occurrence.\n
I genuinely enjoyed all the simple explanations about this fantasy world and all his interactions, especially since NO TIME WAS WASTED. They didn't waste half an episode showing them traveling some where, or 10 minutes explaining why something works and why something doesn't.\n\n
Art, and sound were all pretty normal for a fun little anime like this. Character development was... There? I guess? But like I said, it's not super deep. I really enjoyed this anime. The MC in here is how the one in Re:Zero SHOULD HAVE been. This anime doesn't beat a dead horse with it's comedy like KonoSuba S2 did.

Have you ever seen people complaining about LN adaptations? Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni is everything those complaints are about. Whether it is done on purpose (parody) or not is a different topic.
I'll start by saying that first few episodes are tragic from technical perspective. Everything happens way too fast, we jump from scene to scene without any proper transition - like in some recap. Add to it this anime being what it is (explained later) and it's no surprise if you want to drop it after one or two episodes. Luckily it gets better after first few world and character introduction episodes.
The storyis as cliche as it gets. No, it's even more than that. The protagonist, Touya, isn't just overpowered - it's whole world that's working in his favour. Things just happen at perfect time for him to profit from them or show off his awesomeness and gather his harem. This aspect of anime is mostly visible in early episodes when he needs to build his fame - it's not so problematic later on.

I had really hard time telling if the story is seriously bad or if it is meant to parody isekai titles that fall into OP MC/harem cliches. On one hand it feels like cheap fanfic written by 8th grader. On the other, story doesn't seem to take itself seriously. All the conflicts are resolved quickly and painlessly without Touya even trying. Actually, most of times it ends up being comedic, even when enemies are serious evil guys.

The general lighthearted feel this anime gives is actually pretty nice. I believe it's not meant to be taken seriously. You just enjoy light comedy and this weird limbo between SoL and adventure.


Now, having very light and comedic story works better if you have nice characters. Smartphone doesn't. The cast is as one-dimensional as it gets. After you saw introduction scene of a character you already know everything there is to know about them. Huge waste, considering it's a harem and story isn't too focused, leaving a lot of time to fill with interactions between characters. 

Touya himself also deserves mention here. There is this meme about Tatsuya Shiba being a god. I wonder what should we make for Touya Mochizuki then? He is just out of scale. While I love OP protagonists, his lack of personality really makes it hard to like him. He is most basic harem MC with the most OP powers I've seen.


When it comes to art, Smartphone isn't anything special. It's pretty bland and action scenes are just weak. Backgrounds are bad. While characters look pretty good, they also lack details. 

Generally speaking "meh".


After everything I wrote above it's hard to admit that, of all the seasonal anime I watched weekly, I waited the most for this one. Call me crazy, but it's ridiculously enjoyable. If I watched all episodes at once it might be different though. I'm pretty sure I'll rewatch it in future, so we will see.


As it is, I'd be hesitant to recommend this anime to anyone. While I liked it a lot, I know it's pretty weak from technical perspective and not everyone would enjoy its light story. 

Hopefully this review will help you make choice whether it's worth watching on your own.

I was pretty surprised to see low ratings on this anime! Its one of my favorite.. Its unique and really exciting.. I really loved everything about it... I dont see why people not liking it.. I think they are too used to common animes that they find it hard to accept something like this bcoz of stupid reasons like main character is op, story is bad or whatever... learn to appreciate something for what it is, not for what it isn't.
many people end up disliking this anime because they where expecting it to be an intense fantasy, action, adventure, filled with incredible fight scenes, deep story lines, dramatic events and even tragic moments similar to Re:Zero then you're gonna be disappointed, it was never intended to be any of those, that's like looking for apples in an orange tree, of course you won't find it.
this is anime is intended to be just a fun anime set in a fantasy world, the kind of anime you watch while while relaxing, it's a chill typeof anime, treat it as such then you will find yourself enjoying this show a lot more.\n\n
there's a scene in Ep.8 that perfectly demonstrates the whole appeal of this show, in this scene the MC builds a bicycle and the Duke tries it out for the first time, seeing a rich old man learning to ride a bicycle is hilarious! a man who has made it in life, has riches, family, material possessions, lands and titles, acting like a child again, seeing such happiness in his face when he finally learns how to ride a bike, that is the kind of appeal this show has, it's meant to be a light hearted fantasy anime you enjoy to relax.

Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni is a mediocre, heck even decent anime. There really is nothing "special" about it. 
Seeing the anime on MAL for the first time, got me excited. I have never read nor heard about the light novel, and therefore the story intrigued me a bit. However, after watching the first episode i learned just how average it is. 
While the concept is new, it follows in the fantasy steps such as SAO and Konosuba, and does everything worse than they did. 
The animation is nothing to brag about, the sound is mediocre and there seems to be no character developmentat all. Now bear in mind that this is only for the first 4 episodes, so development might come, however it seems unlikely from how it has developed so far.


But worst of all to me, is the story. While the concept seemed intriguing at first, it never made it through to create a good anime. Smartphone is part of the title, yet the part it plays in the anime is very VERY small. Instead they just decided to make the protagonist strong, making the smartphone obsolete.


There is nothing in the first 4 episodes making this anime worth watching, except that it somehow still manages to be enjoyable. It lacks in every aspect of being a good anime, yet the small skits and interactions between characters still makes it rather fun to watch.


If you are sitting at home, in need of something with a very light mood, and just need a little bit to smile about, then watch it. 


Otherwise steer clear of it.


Anime: 3/10

Enjoyment: A good 7/10.

Well... as an Anime Casual (see Joey/TheAnimeMan's video about Anime Enthusiast types) i pretty much enjoy this one particular anime. Though there's a bit of bad editing in here, it didn't effect the story that much. Some people might think this as a "another SAO-like anime", but it's not that close to SAO,. SAO's Kirito is too overpowered and a bit "fourth wall breaking" since he knew how to beat the game. But in this anime, the main male character Mochizuki Touya, doesn't have any knowledge about the world he's in, and even though Kami-sama boosted almost every bit of his stats and his magicalstats to a degree which you can assume "Overpowered". But i think that Touya still could die at any moment since he is always a bit underguarded and sometimes not even awaring the situations that he's in. Pretty much this anime was made to be enjoyed and not to be taken too seriously. That concludes my review. MystoganMiku, out.

This was overall an average anime hence the 7 rating. Basically a C.
Based on the way anime are rated in MAL this def doesn't deserve a 6 but isn't good enough to be a 7.5 or above.
I found this anime to be entertaining. It wasn't enough to keep me excited through the whole thing, but it definitely had its ups.
Story: 7 - 6 / C - D
Now given that this is a harem anime, you can't expect a decent story out of it. It's either harem or it's story. However, the concept of this world and the idea behind bringing a smartphone to another worldwas unique. The combination of invincible main character and magic is unique. And of course the fact that this is  one of the few, if not only anime where the harem is completed and not just half-assed friendships.


Art: 7 - 6 / C - D

Given that it's 2017, this has decent animations. Not the usual overdone CG bs nor is it particularly amazing. None of the characters are particulary memorable other than hetrochromia-chan.


Sound: 7 - 6 / C - D

Again, neither good sounds nor bad sounds. It's pretty average and ordinary.


Character: 7 / C

This is where I will give a solid C for this anime. Because the characters ACTUALLY DO SOMETHING. How many of you have seen a harem where the relationships from episode 2 and episode 12 or 13 are the exact same. Everyone should have their hands up. Nope, at least they go somewhere. Although the "sorry" card may have been pulled dropping everyone's position.


Enjoyment: 8 - 6 / B - D

The anime jumps around and has an interesting concept. It truly feels like it was made for the purpose of entertainment and doesn't have the feels of a try-hard studio. Obviously it can't compete to anything taking their work seriously, but this anime is something everyone can enjoy.


I actually think that too many people take anime seriously. Judging an anime based on it's subjective quality versus the entertainment it provides is pretty off-handed if you ask me.


This anime is a solid 7.0 or a C in my book.

I don't understand the hate for this one.
Smartphone is a very average anime. It does nothing spectacular in any way. It doesn't attempt to push the Isekai genre..it doesn't attempt to be anything but what it is. A dumb fantasy show.
Smartphone is dumb. The characters are mostly hollow and pointless. Much of the show is overly sexual and the main character couldn't be more generic. Smartphone wears all of this on its sleeve and to think otherwise should in itself be considered a falsehood.
This show was just fun. A young, well to do, man saves a bunch of people, goes on stupid journeys and, ofcourse, wins the hearts of a lot of women in the process. Nothing is difficult for him because God blessed him to be OP. This makes it very easy for moments of power fantasy and ridiculousness to insue.\n\n
I can't believe someone would watch this for 12 episodes and think that this was anything more or less than that. It was serviceable and I look forward to the statues and doujins that will come out as a result of this average show.

"Isekai wa Smartphone no Tomo ni, a series so generic that yet manages to be enjoyable in a way."
If anything that's how I'd describe this series. 
Having already watched in the past other series of the genre "Isekai" I couldn't help but to roll my eyes so far up my skull the first time I knew about this one that I could see my brain for a second; and even so I gave it a try, you know, just for the sake of it. And in the end I gotta say... I was surprised by how this series managed to actually do things in away it actually ended up being fun.


Now don't get me wrong, the series is STILL trash in many ways, and uses so many of the clichés in the book that I'm surprised I didn't actually dropped it halfway through. In some scenes the backgrounds were so badly rendered into the final product you could tell they completely overlooked the quality control. The story is nothing extraordinary from the Isekai genre aside of the elements where the MC uses his smartphone and the fact he's probably the most powerful being in that world, and on top of that it's also a freaking HAREM. And BOY, don't even get me started with the animation. 


But still, what I found enjoyable was that despite being bad, it wasn't being a total tryhard in becoming a serious series and just focused on being exactly what the premise shows: a fun adventure in a fantasy world. The MC (who is possibly the blandest, most generic character at the beginning of the series) doesn't get too much of a progression until the end of the series where he actually starts making decisions a normal 15 year old teenager would do. It also manages to break (in some really, REALLY few occasions) some clichés from the standard anime harems, which was also a pleasant surprise. The MC's absolutely ridiculous overpowering is put to good use and he knows it. He has the power of God and Waifus on his side anyway.


Back to the story, and as mentioned before, there's nothing extraordinary aside of the character having a smartphone and being super OP. Not only that, but it also manages to actually go through so many stories in the span of 12 episodes which gives the viewer something to be entertained despite knowing that in the end it's all gonna be ok for the cast. Other Isekai series would probably go for 2 or 3 arcs per season, but this series managed to solve everything on the span of 24 minutes and then pass onto another scenario to bring more elements to the story, becoming an actual episodic series. A missed opportunity for character development? Sadly yes, but it doesn't really matter for this story.


I also found some magical elements and the world building to be pretty decent and even interesting too. For a character who can wield virtually any type of magic, he knows exactly what to do when the situation arises, and even bringing stuff from our world into there. A decision so painfully obvious anyone would do had we also get that amount of power into another world.


The characters are also just archetypes, they're not characters per se since none of them have any actual motivation other than wanting to bone the MC. Despite that, they manage to be charming in their way and provide good support to the cast in the end. They sadly get little to none progression in the season, but hey, at least they manage to set their feelings straight at some point. A prowess so monumental in other series that it's impressive a series like Isekai wa Smartphone beat them in that. Bonus points there. If a Season 2 ever hits, I hope we get to see more of their pasts and deeper, more meaningful motivations. But who am I kidding? We probably won't see that.


So in the end, this series is bad but not a total trainwreck. It's not mediocre either, but not a masterpiece at all. I'd say it's pretty decent at most. The story moves fast so it's not boring or slow, and the characters have their own charm, which compensates for the lack of character development. It's just a series to have fun with and not take seriously in the end. Anime elitists will pan this one, obviously, and younger viewers with not too much experience with anime will probably love it. And I? I personally liked it. I knew it was gonna be bad, but at least it managed to make me invested in Touya and the girls for 12 weeks straight. Here's for a better produced season 2 someday. Or also just read the LN.


FINAL SCORE: Guilty Pleasure / 10.


Also watch the dub for a better enjoyment. There the characters sound less painfully bland and it has more humor. No, really, they managed to do a good work with that. Major props.

Your typical Isekai-style anime.
You are placed into a whole new world in a fantasy setting right off the bat and if you enjoy these types of anime then most likely, you will also enjoy this one.
From a personal standpoint, i was always anticipating and was overjoyed for the release of the next episode, always intrigued as to what will happen next and what new characters i would encounter.
The story itself is nothing new, it follows the usual isekai format of someone being transported to another world and is left to fend for themselves and fit into society. However this show does actually make it prettyexciting from the start by making the MC Overpowered. This allows you to focus more on the world rather than spending time waiting for his strength to grow.\n\n
Admittedly it is not the best anime, especially of this genre however since i always enjoy romance and harem types, i immediately got hooked into this and it became my weekly relaxation anime compared to much more intense series.\n\n
It is well worth the watch, even if it is just to relax and enjoy some action and romantic affairs.\n\n
Overall i really enjoyed this anime and would like to recommend it to anyone whom is familiar with the Isekai genre or would like to experiment.

Quite the disappointment. Isekai brings absolutely nothing new to the Harem table. The only benefit being that harem fans can watch it just for half-hearted entertainment and nothing else...
Story: 4/10
The lowest I've ever given. The story (if there was one) was horribly cliched (if not completely) and though cliches are not bad (coming from a cliche hater) it's always good to bring at least a pinch of originality in an anime and unfortunately the only original thing in this anime was the smartphone being there in the new world (hence the name, there's nothing else original). Nevertheless, to end on a positive note it wasa fun story more or less... And don't get me started on that joke of a last episode. That was hell at it's finest, and I'm not talking High School DXD hell, the *hell* hell.


Art: 8/10


Perhaps the highest I can give this anime, it's art is really good. It was beautiful, the way the characters looked was incredibly accurate and accentuated their expressions. The backgrounds were good too. Colour was (maybe the only) one thing this anime excelled at. It was simply lovely to look at.


Sound: 7/10


The sound was below average. The VAs did an okay-ish job. I expected better. Except for Linze (who contributed 4 points out of 7) no other character's VA did a great job. Maybe except for resident dense MC Touya who did quite well. The OP/ED was another of the many things I was disappointed at. The OP was average (being generous here) while the ending was forgettable. All of them. Other than that nothing else was that great in the sound section.


Character: 4/10


Yeesh. Now I gotta write this too? The character development was an absolute disappointment too. Horribly cliched characters with zero development were both a Lose-Lose for Isekai Smartphone. Though there are many (useless) characters I've gone into detail for only those who had the most screentime. The girls fall in love with him for absolutely no reason. Even if this is a harem there should be specific reasons for a girl to love a boy. Heck, even To LOVE Ru and High School DXD and Rosario to Vampire and many other popular harem anime had girls with even half a good reason to fall for the main guy but Isekai had none of that...


Touya: The zillionth Dense Harem MC. Touya is the Kirito of this anime right here. And anyone burnt out by SAO will have no need to go further than that. For those who haven't, Touya was your everyday dense character who is OP throughout the anime. Now there's nothing wrong with an OP character (example Saitama) if done right. But unfortunately in this anime little was done right. So to get back, Touya does very little to make himself acceptable to most people's eyes (maybe to those snotty teens who like nothing but fanservice and zero plot).


Elze: Another failed 2017 attempt at a good Tsundere, Else is how NOT to make a Tsundere character. Like the other girls, she has no specific reason to like Touya... Apart from the fact that she is used in all the cliched flat chest jokes there was nothing memorable about her. Maybe her long purple hair? Nope.


Yae: A character I quite liked at first, she was the equivalent of left out bread. As in, good at first, and moss covers it and spoils it later. Yae was a character who I came to loathe in the later part of the anime because the studio constantly tried to paint her as a Tsundere (another 2017 failed attempt) which backfired horribly. They could have gone lengths to make her good but that could be said for every other aspect of this anime.


Linze: Save the best for last, Linze was probably the only good character out here. Though she too had no reason to love Touya at least her *reactions* and behaviour were quite believable. Still, like the other girls she was also a disappointment (how many times have I said disappointment already???). Towards the end I started liking her a little as she improved her personality a bit (started being more aggressive) but other than that nothing.


Enjoyment: 6/10


Being a harem fan I still enjoyed this a bit (a bit mind you) and I could overlook many of it's cliches but for this review I couldn't as they were countable faults... It had a huge share of cliches and disappointing moments but in the end, the weak comedy and lame romance and harem were somewhat okay by the end. Either because it grew in you or because you were happy it was finally over (maybe both for me).


Overall: 5.8


Overall this anime gets a 5.8 from me. I wish it'd be lower but the calculations didn't let me do so. Isekai Smartphone is a cliched adventure to harem land where everyone falls in love with you for no reason at all and you're OP too. That's basically the whole 12 episodes in a nutshell. But to end on a positive note, Isekai Smartphone is in the end a somewhat fun anime to watch. It's something you should watch only when you're extremely bored or when you've nothing better to do. Perhaps recommend this to someone who plans to watch BnP or CitH and they'll thank you maybe. A great anime for those wanting to pass time, or just to have a laugh and if you're me, watch it for the heck of it.


P.S: Linze is best girl. Yae at a close second. <3

Okay, here is my first review so its going to be horrible
So Konosuba is abou-
Wait this isn't Konosuba let me restart
In another world with my smartphone (I'll refer to it as Not Konosuba, since I'm not typing out that entire title again) is about a not edgy version of Kirito in a medievalish world with his smartphone. That's pretty much it.
Story - 2
This anime has no story at all, the most "story" is when you are meeting characters. Everything else is pretty much just filler that shows off how overpowered our MC is, or random fanservice. Mostly everything our protagonist does is predictable, even theone unpredictable thing he did became predictable once he did it a million times (multiplying poorly animated beams of light and shooting them at people).


Art - 4

If we were to get rid of the characters clothing and hair, then change their eye colors to blue, there would be no difference in the females. I feel like they just copy and pasted the same character 4 times, then changed it up a bit when dealing with the girls. The guys on the other hand are actually unique, and have ACTUAL FACES. It's annoying how similar the King and Duke are, though its easy to remember which one is which.

As for environments, I'd say it is pretty average compared to most shows. Not Konosuba isn't horrible or outstanding when it comes to this, its simply average.


Sound - 5

I never really paid attention to any music other than the OP and ED(s) since I was /trying/ to enjoy the show, so I'll only comment on those. The songs weren't bad, but I'd like to point out that the visuals were horrific. They just showed off the characters while playing music in the background for 90 seconds. The ED shows off some random harem girl doing nothing, even if the episode had nothing to do with said girl. I'd love to go deeper into it, but I don't think the appropriate place for my 12 paragraph rant on how bad the ED / OP is belongs in the sound portion.


Character - 1

Remember when I said it felt like they copied and pasted the same character 4 times when dealing with the females? They did the exact same things with the personalities, excluding shameless princess girl. The harem girls have about as much personality as a piece of paper. I also don't  understand why every person who holds political power acts like a child, it simply doesn't make sense to me.

I saved not Kirito for last. I'll cut him some slack, since a lot of protagonists are like this, but he has no defining traits at all. He's nice and somewhat perverted I guess, that's all that comes to mind when I think of not Kirito. The one unforgivable thing about this character is that he barely reacts to serious situations (for example, when he died, he didn't give a shit and just talked to God like they had known eachother for his entire life).


Enjoyment - 6

This show does have a lot of flaws, though it wasn't completely horrible. It was fun to predict what was going to happen and have it be right, though once your predictions are right 100% of the time, it gets pretty boring. The majority of the jokes weren't my taste, but there were a good amount that were, so I guess that's nice.

Oh, I'd like to mention some things that caught my attention, too. Take Not Kirito's coat jacket thing and turn it black, and he's now Kirito. Big tits magical girl did Megumin's explosion thing. God was completely ignored for the majority of the show.


Overall, this anime gets 4/10 from me.


One day, I was scrolling through the anime list on Hulu, and saw this anime. I took one look at its description, and knew how bad it was going to be. I watched episode one, almost laughing at how bad it was. By episode 6, I was certain that this was just a pathetic cash-grab. Honestly, 4/10 is generous on my part. Lets hope that the next Isekai anime isn't as horrible as this one.

*possible spoilers ahead*
Firstly, this is my first review, so don't be harsh on me please. Secondly, my overall rating of the anime is how much I enjoyed watching it, that's how I rate and critique most of the anime I watch. Now let's begin with the review.
In no regards, is this anime good. It's full of cliches, stereotypical and dull characters, a studpidly overpowered and clueless protagonist with a stupidly large harem and of course, to top it all off, set in another world.
However, don't get me wrong, the anime is bad, horrible even, but it's refreshing and honestly fun to watch something so generic,personally I found myself enjoying all the protagonists OP-ness and his harem of women, and watching everything go right for him for some reason.


The story is just a teenager named Tomoya being reborn in a new world as a perfect harem lead and more overpowered than anyone in this world, you watch him strike awe into everyone around him while he builds his harem. That's about it.


The art is nothing special, not flashy or unique, but not bad either. Though, can't complain about fan service though, am I right?


I never really noticed/was aware of any background music, so I can't really comment on that, the OP is, well, meh, and the ED is too.


The characters are generic, dull, stereotypical and fall perfectly into your everyday harem.


Despite how much I've said the anime is shit/mediocre, I'll say it again, its surprisingly, very enjoyable to watch.


This is probably an anime you should watch when you you're bored/got nothing else to watch and just looking for something relaxing and enjoyable.

This review may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Where do I even begin with this? I'm guessing the author also thought the same thing, because this anime has little of were to start from. But let's try to start at the supposed start, the very first episode where we are introduced to our main character... who just so happens to become the ultimate Mary Sue of isekai anime for the flimsiest reason ever since Santa Claus. We get practically no introduction to his past or his goals or even a semblance of personality beyond being "a good kid". Now an animated representation of adeity, who apparently is inadvertedly responsible for our main character's death in his world, wants to make amends by reincarnating him into another world where he can live the life that was cut short from him. And just to spice up the deal, the boy gets all the buffs, both physical and magical, that a god can give and even gets to ask for 1 extra wish (as thought the chance to live on a new fantasy world while buffed to max level in every aspect isn't enough). And the little dork with the charisma of a breadbox asks to bring his damn, excuse me, titular SmartPhone (what brand? nobody knows, nobody cares). But what good could it be to him? He won't be able to call anyone, he won't be able to recharge his battery, it'll be little more than some souvenir from a world he left behind. Not to worry! The god-man is cool enough to buff EVEN THE SMARTPHONE ITSELF to run on magic power AND have God on speed-dial, in addition to several other features which will all combine to turn the damn thing into a literal reality-warping tool. And off the kid goes onto his new adventure in a new world of fantasy and magic. Yay. What shall be his first heroic deed? Saving a couple of girls from some goons... how original. And so the first 2 members of his harem are introduced right in the first 15 minutes of the 1st episode.  In the mean time, while discovering that he is indeed super f****** broken overpowered that can use any type of magic that he wants from that world, including those that should be unique to just 1 person, he gets to add more members to his harem, almost 1 per episode, as they are attracted by the gravitational force of his main protagonist d***. Including the clearly underage ones. ESPECIALLY the clearly underage ones. All while revealing little to no semblance of a relateable or even likable personality. All we get is Mr Perfect Perfection that can do no wrong, beats all baddies, gets all girls, etc etc, all the boring isekai protagonist tropes turned up to 11. World-building would probably be a bit more interesting if it wasn't being constantly overshadowed by just how AMAZING the main character-kun is and how he can LITERALLY ACCESS THE COMMAND CONSOLE OF THE UNIVERSE. You might be wondering how the art style and scene-play holds up to all of this. Well, wonder no longer, as the animation is mediocre at best, using the same generic art style that's been overly used in every other anime series this last couple of decades and the pacing of the animation itself contracts and expands more frequently than a beating heart. To the point where they present some generic fight scene one second and the next throw in an ecchi scene that looks like it used 90% of the series budget to animate. I'm not going to lie: I like me some ecchi here and there, but when the quality of animation contrasts so harshly with what's supposed to be the main focus, the overall result will just be disappointing.\n
In summary: the whole series feels that it was made just to tick off some boxes on a list and not to actually present a work of originality as it should. The story is irregular, has no clear goal and is rife with awkward coincidences strictly happening to benefit the main character and his ever growing harem of future wives (which the show even clearly states will happen because of polygamy laws in that world, now ain't that a coincidence?). Now, this is without having read any light novel (if it exists) but if only we would get some sort of backstory to main character-kun as to know what makes him tick or why he is the way he is and not just some discardable hollow shell that can be easily replaced by a house cat, the show could have been a wee bit more interesting. All it needs is to tone down main character-kun's spotlight for a bit and try to present a few relatable features. As it is, he's just fiddling with his god-phone, breaking every single law of both his new and old worlds, doing the impossible without a clear reason why.

My first time posting a review here, because oh boy, if it isn't one of the worst series I've ever seen.
Besides trying to watch the anime, I've also read all 3 volumes that are currently translated, with the 4th being released soon.
Tbh this series is basically a rip-off of some of the elements from KonoSuba and The Man Picked up by the Gods (Light Novel, if you read the prologue part you'll get what I mean, it's pretty much 100% same, and yes, TMPG came out a year before Smartphone), while adding a bland and dense MC, whose closest equivalent from the forementioned series wouldbe Mitsurugi (aka the guy that got his magical sword stolen) and that character is a joke aimed at dense/bland/op MC archetype. There's pretty much nothing to his character. I could quote heroines of GJ-bu talking about their MC (who is similar to this one) "let's nickname him 'White Rice', because his plain personality goes with everything".\n
Another major thing is that everything is convenient for the MC... all the time. The solution to the problem is either already in his posession or appears right away. He also has pretty much no ambition or will to improve. \n
I can't find any information on how many episodes will be released, but I'm guessing it's gonna be 12, so about 2 volumes worth of story. If so, the anime won't even reach the part where MC's personality reaches the bearable levels...\n
I guess it's an okay show if you don't have anything more original to watch. From the opinions I've gathered in a certain community it also appears to be enjoyed by kids-young teens, though it will probably end after they get to experience some more creative series.

This is the most cliche anime you could ever hope to watch. Imagine a stripped down Konosuba where the characters have no depth whatsoever. All the issues that the MC might face are instantly solved. There is no tension, depth, mystery, anything but that's it's strength. 
It's refreshing to see an anime where everything ever goes right for the MC. 
>>Story - 3
I would say -SPOILER- but after you watch the first 1-3 episodes - the same kinda thing happens over and over again so it depends what you count as a spoiler?
Premise is the MC dies by mistake. "God", as an apology and agesture of good will, reincarnates him into a fantasy world and lets him have one wish granted in this world. He picks his smartphone and "God" fixes it so it'll work in the fantasy world.


He then goes to a fantasy world and he finds he can cast EVERY spell in the fantasy universe and can solve everyone's problems. He acquires a collection of stereotypical girls who all fall in love with him. That's about the entirety of the plot. 


Dragons! No problem! -ZAP- Dead!

Blindness! No problem! -ZAP- Healed!

Attempted murder mystery! -ZAP- Solved!


>>Art - 7


It's pretty in a generic fantasy anime sort of way.


>>Sound - 7


Generic fantasy anime.


>> Character - 3


None of the characters have personalities. The girls are all the same bland pretty anime Mary-Sues who don't have much to say. If they are a girl - there is a 200% chance that they fancy the main character. Male characters (apart from the MC) are background and almost non-existant.


>> Enjoyment. - 7


It's so bad that it is refreshing. It's nice to see everything go right for someone for a chance.

tbh, I am no big fan of harems. I hate it usually because the mc is really bland or the girls are usually too silly/characterless/cliched. 
Another fact -- I guess, you would call this anime also a typical harem anime. I was not interested in it initially. My friend suggested it and I read the synopsis, I decided it would be a waste of time and left it in my PTW list for a long time. But then I decided to watch it after all (I don't know exactly why though).
Thank god I did. I wouldn't call it a great anime or anything but itdid well the things it was supposed to do. It was definitely better than average -- in fact quite good and refreshing. 


(Actual review begins here I guess)

For starters, the mc seemed to actually possess a 'brain' and thus did not seem to be a perverted idiot. The story lacks in depth or seriousness. This anime is definitely not something you wanna take seriously. This is probably one of those that kinda refreshes your mind after watching hours of serious stuff.


The mc is overpowered right from the start. But, that is okay. I think it was better this way than having a pathetic character ending up with a harem. Moreover, the mc was also pretty smart. Not overly smart but definitely smarter than your average characters. And, I also believe the girls were not just introduced to 'be a part of his harem'. They had some role to play in almost all fights. For some reason the mc is still pretty dense when it comes to relationships, but it is bearable. He is not stupid, and tries to actually think through stuff. 


The comedy was alright. I am a hard shell to crack when it comes to comedy, but at least it wasn't forced or painful to watch. It definitely put a smile on my face throughout the season. 


Now for the ending -- it was pretty satisfying which is quite rare for harems (one of the reasons why I hate them). It also raises a possibility for another season -- if it gets one I am sure to watch it. 


So, in the end, I would say this is one of the underrated anime out there. As I said before, it may not have perfected everything but it did not fail flat in anything either. Therefore,  for anyone having second thoughts about watching this series, I think, this anime deserves a watch for sure.

oh wow cool it's an isekai anime, I wonder if anything new and interesting will be done in thi- nope this is horrible.


I read the synopsis a couple months ago and I got really interested and excited for it. Since then, I've hyped over it, thinking it'll be something really good like another konosuba (comedy in isekai) or NGNL (bored of life, goes off to do world-changing activities) mix. I was wrong. I've never seen something as predictable as this. This guy literally runs around with a harem to do quests even though he has the ability to use every magic type and knowledge from his world.


It's actually the most mediocre anime I've ever seen.

- Isekai

- is op and extremely bland in personality

- helps girls

- gets harem

- MC also has kirito coat (except white)


After the second episode, I wanted to drop this. However, I wanted to watch the third one hoping that something interesting will happen but only to be disappointed. This harem over-credits the MC on the most obvious things (ex: episode 3, wow, you're so smart you figured this out, even though it's extremely obvious). The feeling I get from watching this anime is pure cringe and annoyance.


I'm not saying that nobody should watch this anime. If you're new to anime and you've only watched <5 or so anime then picking this up might be a good one but if you're a person who has watched a lot of anime and seen a lot of (op MC with harem) cliches then this one will be a waste of time. 





tl;dr

If you've watched a lot of anime of this genre (OP and overly-nice MC gets harem ex: SAO, Asterisk War) I wouldn't watch this because this is a very cheesy and predictable anime which will only annoy you as you watch this. If you're new to anime or this genre then I guess watching this would be fine but a better recommendation would be something like Asterisk War which is somewhat more bearable.


tl;dr of tl;dr

It's pretty bad. Don't watch this. Go watch something else that isn't this unless you're new to anime.

Straight up, this is the most generic harem anime I've seen so far. The story is bland and they treat the most op character like its nothing. Oh? There's a problem? I'll just use my smartphone...BOOM problem solved. Basically, he's nothing without his smartphone, so there's nothing to his character. The anime just gives him powers and he just uses them without a sweat, so he becomes the most op character in the entire world. He's not being challenged, cause he just gets powers for free. 
The anime itself isn't as bad as people say it is. Don't get me wrong, it's bad, but It'snot really bad....it's just bland as hell. I'd say if you like cheezy op heroes that get the girls, then watch it. The fight scenes are a joke, but hey! He gets the girls in the end!

First of all, I've heard people say this anime is absolute shit. In fact I have yet to meet a person who has even considered this to be even an "okay" anime. Second of all, I'm not a super critical person when it comes to watching anime. I read the description and if it sounds even remotely interesting then I'll probably watch it. Lastly I haven't been watching anime for long, only 4 months, I have however watched a total of 43 anime series within that time, some being a lot longer than others. So this is just my opinion, if you don't agree wellthat's fine, everyone has their different tastes\n
I started watching anime only around 4 months ago and when I did, I didn't exactly knew which animes were the one's that people loved so much. Back then I went out on MAL and found this one, watched it and fully enjoyed every second of it, the art, the characters and even the plot too. It was also one of the first animes that I've watched (which may explain why I enjoyed it so much). I thought the concept was interesting and I felt like I could relate to the main character since we actually are a little similar in personality, and looks. I can understand why people think this anime isn't good, they've watched probably a lot more than me. However I prefer something somewhat more innocent, lighthearted and funny like this over something super dramatic like Attack on Titans (not saying it's a bad anime, please don't hurt me). So hopefully this helps you understand a little more of what I think of this show.

I will try to not give too many spoilers. But I will mention names and some characters and some of their abilities.
Well then let's start with the story. 
-Story- (4/10)
This anime does not have an outstanding story nor complex plot twists that blow your mind, at least not in this season. (As a novel reader I can truly say this is just the tip of the iceberg)
In this anime storyline, mostly about the romance but sometimes the story just jumps into a  fight and must say from the first minute you can say how will this gonna end.But little details, comedy(a little) and romancemakes that standard and predictable story pretty enjoyable. But if you are looking for a complex story with twisted ends sir this anime is not for you.(At least this season.) 

And I need to mention in the show main character is overpowered but it is kinda funny to watch. 


-Art- (9/10)

Well, art! First of all, we need to split this into 3 pieces landscapes, characters, and cities.

Landscape(out view of a city counts as a Landscape)

Landscape, in one word they are really outstanding. I mean studio clearly spend some time on those designs. You can clearly feel an ambiance with a look at them. If I speak for my self sometimes I pause the show and look at the landscapes. (You see the story is not that gripping.)

Characters

Actually, they are all good. But there is nothing outstand  beside the girls (You get what I mean.) 

Cities(Inside of the cities)

Well, those can be better. In the show you cant fell the city it kinda feels like one street city.


-Sound- (7/10)

I can just say intro and outro are good... Just kidding, but really they are really good. Fx and environment sound seem ok to me but some of the people say lip sync is bad, as a subtitle watcher I really can not confirm or deny that.


-Characters- (7/10)

Eh, that is a problem in this anime that because if you are watching for mystic adventure those characters may not be enjoyable. But if you are watching for comedy and romance then they are wonderful.


-Enjoyment- (9/10)

As I say in the story part you are not going to like this if you are looking that kinda story telling. But if you are here for a mystic adventure along with romance and comedy and if you like the harem shows with cute fights in it, sir this show for you. Beside that this anime has a light novel series, with that I meant to say there is a long story.


-Overall- (8/10)

I do not care too much about the story and I pretty like shows that involve cute fights over romance, the addition of mystic adventure is just extra decoration for me but I loved it.

And finally, this show is not underrated or overrated. When a show targets too many categories it cannot be perfect on every one of them. But in this way, they can access more audience. Usually, studios use this technique when they already planed more than one season.

Disclaimer: This is a harem anime.
I don't know what a lot of these reviewers were expecting.  What harem besides maybe clannad can you look at through a microscope and not expect to find flaws when you search for them?  To each their own I suppose.
I went in expecting very little tbh, but despite what I considered a pretty low score (I am starting to understand even ratings in the 6's have potential) I enjoyed the show.  Does it utilize the traditional tropes?  Yes.  Is the main character a bit OP? Yeah.  Did I go in expecting code geass? Hellno.  I expected a goofy ass harem anime with magic, and that is what I was presented.


Now let me actually detail what I considered flaws despite low expectations:


1) The amount and variance of magic used was redundant and unexplorative despite great opportunities with the vast elements illustrated.


2) The usual harem issue of naive main character and immature relationship developments (but at least one character was straightforward).


3) Typically anticlimactic ending, but that is expected with harem anime as well.


There are more flaws, but I believe going in looking to enjoy it rather than scrutinize every blatant failed bit of potential would ruin nearly any anime.  Same applies here. 


In the end, I've seen worse, I've seen better, but I enjoyed it.

I jumped on the bandwagon of hating on this idiotic show and expected it to be so bad I'd be able to laugh at the cringe. I'm frankly a little bit disappointed it actually wasn't all that bad, a horribly dumb setup like "guy gets to respawn in other world and of all the awful crap he could choose he brings his stupid phone and to top it off he becomes invincible" should not have had much redeeming quality at all.
The story starts about as badly as anything possibly can, a teen guy is informed he died but just sips tea and goes "K." asif the people he left behind would not be bothered in the slightest by his death, what the cheese is wrong with this moron? Same fool gets a once in a million years chance to ask the boss of the universe any random favor before being resurrected in another world, he chooses to keep his phone and just have it tweaked to work with the other world. At this point it's normal to want to high five him in the face with a chair.


Things move forward, he gets more magic power than anyone in the new world thus eliminating any doubt that he will ever face any situation he can't handle almost immediately. I didn't like "One Punch Moron" but at least that show captured the struggle of someone fighting the boredom of being invincible, this anime had zero of that. The only struggle he faces is what to do with all the girls that throw themselves all over him and he's often so oblivious to their feelings you end up wanting to punch him in the nuts because you feel sorry for the girls.


So how doesn't the above end up being enough to warrant a rock bottom score? As bland and aimless as this OP moron is he actually does and says occasional funny things and he does in fact appreciate seeing girls exposed as opposed to many pathetic stereotype protagonists in other harem animes. How often do the girls get exposed then? Like 3 times in the whole season, and even then they don't get exposed enough for an ecchi rating. This stuff is so tame it's frankly annoying but it is slightly alleviated by the girls being rather sweet and enjoyable most of the time even with a bunch of clothes on.


At the end of the day this anime rides on bad jokes that are sometimes actually really funny and it does have generally pretty good art and sound. I'd even welcome a second season, despite my expectations remaining low since the main story is still crap.

Disclaimer: This is a spoiler-free review on the anime "Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni". Please excuse me if I make a mistake or you don't understand a part, as English is not my first language. Thank you.
Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni: A generic anime where there are
Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni has as a great merit to be the perfect example of the generic that can be many anime that are currently broadcast.
Many times I have said that many anime series in recent years seem to be mass produced. It is as if someone has written a pattern and the others simplymake copies of it. Well, to be fair, I will say that most people take the time to make some small adjustments ... but very small ones.

 

However, from time to time there arises a series that does not want to complicate life and simply copies as is to the pattern. It is that I imagine Patora Fuyuhara, at the time he was creating this novel, with a notebook where he was checking that all the points were included.


- Element isekai - check

- Protagonist so OP that fights are a joke - check

- Perfect one-dimensional protagonist for the audience to be projected on it - check

- Princess protagonist - check

- Fake harem with many waifus - check

- Generic plot dominated by slice of life - check

- Secondary characters that only exist to praise the protagonist - check

- Waifus whose personality is dominated by a cliché and their love for the protagonist - check

- Antagonists that are only there for the protagonist to shine - check

- A lot of fanservice - check

- Romance reduced to the girls trying to make the senpai look at them - check


Many series have some of these characteristics, but very few have all of them. And worse, very few have all without having made any changes. I think that if something can be boasted about Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni is to be faithful to the pattern.


In fact, talking about this series in depth does not make sense. Just look at the characters, read the previous check list and you will know what the anime is about.


The only thing I could say additional is that in the final two episodes they wanted to make adjustments in the romance by forcing things a little; however, that was so pathetic and was so badly done that it was better to have continued with the manual. I have not read the novels, but I would dare to say that what happened in the last two episodes does not go there.


It is incredible that at this point these clunkers continue to emerge that only serve to divert resources that could be used to encourage truly good series; or continue with better works.


It's sad that a grotesque like Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo has managed to get an anime; while much better novels of the same genre such as Arifureta Shokugyou by Sekai Saikyou, or Boku wa Isekai by Fuyo Mahou to Shoukan Mahou wo Tenbin and Kakeru are still waiting for an opportunity.


Even if what they wanted was an isekai with a lot of slice of life, there are great options such as Isekaijin no Tebikisho and Risou no Himo Seikatsu. How long are you going to continue looking for generic novels, without soul and with princess protagonists?


And the fact that I'm not talking about the jewels that are Chinese novels. With so much material to choose from to make an anime (Against the Gods, Great Demon King God and Devil World, My Wife is a Beautiful CEO, Warlock of the Magus World, etc); the geniuses who make decisions it occurred to them that the best options were Gin no Guardian, Cheating Craft and Bloodivores ... This last one need to turn off the light ...


SUMMARY


This series is so generic that it deserves an equally generic review.


Personal rating:


1/10.

This is probably the most anticlimactic anime that I've ever watched. It's like a less comedic, worse version of Konosuba. In this review I'll tell you what this anime is about and what makes it so bad.
In this anime we get introduced to the main character that died not according to God's plan. For some reason the main character don't give a shit. He's super humble about God accidentally killing him and he doesn't care that he's dead and will never meet his family again. But God gives him another chance to live and sends him to another world with magic and all sorts ofcool things. When God sends him to this world God gives him his phone, max level magic and basically becoming the most powerful being in this world.


So that's the introduction. The reason why this anime is so bad is because he's super OP in a bad way. I like OP characters like One Punch Man and Meliodas from seven deadly sins because for example. Meliodas is funny. He doesn't care what others think of him, he has a goal and tries to find all the deadly sins to make his goal. One punch man has both conflict and goal. His conflict is that he's so powerful people think he's faking it. His goal is to become the most famous superhero.


Now we have Touya. He is super powerful. He is loved by everybody and as soon as there's conflict he exterminates it. Touya has no goal and he just "goes with the flow". Every episode of this anime is him walking, seeing a quest on the quest wall, asking his friends if they should go because it seems interesting. And then they go and do the quest with no problem. He practically just do things because he has nothing better to do. He has no weakness and he has no goal. That's what makes this anime so bad.

Oh dear, what have we done. 
I actually recommend people watch this show. Not because it is good, but precisely the opposite. Watching Isekai wa Smartphone is like a crash course for the anime connoisseur in how to quickly spot horrifically bad and blatantly unoriginal writing. Throughout the entire show, red flags pop up everywhere hinting to how the creators are just trying to make a quick buck off a popular genre.
-Lazy character design. Every single character in this show is a one dimensional shadow clone of a character from a better show. This is not an exaggeration. Every. Single. One. 
-The main character hasNO personality. None. Zero. He's always positive about everything and never makes a mistake. His mood never changes. He can legitimately do anything. 


-Right from the start, the animation quality is nothing special despite being a fantasy setting. That's how you know you are watching seasonal trash - if you can tell that a shows investors are holding back it's a sign of serious caution. 


-The first girls he run into already want the D for absolutely no reason. You could take a random college student fresh out of creative writing and they could probably make better romantic setups than this. 


-It takes the main character zero time to solve any problem. Any hint of suspense is gone. All plot devices exist solely to get to the next female character to commence the same jokes you have heard a thousand times.


The fantasy genre almost seems like it shouldn't be able to be screwed up. By placing the setting in another world with different rules, it gives the writer absolute creative freedom in how they wish to build that world. These alternative dimension shows create a blank canvas for which anything is possible. And yet, here we are. It doesn't matter how much freedom you grant to people with no talent. These scrubs somehow managed to vomit up an anime that has both an abysmally nonexistent plot with characters that are all amazingly boring with zero development. Anime that is low tier but still enjoyable tend to screw up either plot or characters, but not them both. Isekai wa Smartphone manages to botch these two critical factors in a way that leaves you in awe at how such an incompetent story even got the funding for an animation in the first place.  


In conclusion, this is the kind of show you can have running in the background on a second monitor while doing something else and you won't miss anything because nothing is happening. It serves as a prime example of poor quality creative plagiarism, to the point where this anime almost defines it.

After reading some reviws on this,I decided to write one of my own.
Now, first things frist, for the people who didn't read the Light Novel (or Web Novel for that matter) maybe you wouldn't know, but the series doesn't take itself seriously.
You shouldn't watch this if you're looking for something that's gonna break all the cliches for the Isekai genre we've been seeing so far, but, if you're looking for something to kick back and relax, then go all out.
One thing the anime couldn't capture well is the protag's inner dialogue. He recognizes the cliches he's in and isn't as dense as the anime makeshim to be (at least in the Web Novel).\n
The simple idea behind this is that, if you want to watch this, don't do it as a critic but rater as a normal viewer. In all honesty, the anime did fall short on a few things the Light Novel and the Web Novel did a better job at (namely scene development, Ende's participation, which is reduced to only a scene in the anime, and character development), but that's just consequences of it being only a 12 episode long anime. If it had more time, then it could have done a much better job at all that.\n
If you really want to see what Isekai Smartphone has to offer, then I recomend either the Light Novel or the Web Novel (both actually). The anime is not bad, but these two do a better job at the crucial points.

So I know why people think the anime is bad/clichéd/unoriginal etc etc. I mean, walk into girls changing, master of all elements aswell adds to some people's dislikes as well I suppose. BUT, the story, the character, enjoyment and everthing is so above average, and being clichéd and unoriginal has nothing to do with it. In the end no anime is the same no matter how you look at it, like OPM is not the same as Mob Psycho 100. This is my favourite anime because, this anime is my type of anime, OP Main Character, is gifted and has the ladies. When people saythis anime doesn't have any depth or isn't realistic (I know that some people like that sort of stuff, now what I'm saying is my own opinion, not hating or nothing), I say, to heck with that. It's an anime, not a biographical and realistic one. Its not meant for serious critique and the sorts.


To sum it up, the good points:

- Great Story, You Have Seen The Character Grow In A New Environment

- Visuals aren't as bad as some people make it out to be, when they make it sound like its quality is like Astro Boy 1961 (I assure you, its above average, imo)

-Gives you something to look forward to, not a 'hard' cliffhanger

-OP MC, Check, Harem, Check, Adventure, Check


Now for the less than average stuff (that other people say) about this anime which shouldn't really be complained about when you have such good stuff in this anime: 

-Action scenes aren't the greatest, I'll admit that, but in its defense, I say they're not bad at all, as I'd say that it's about average, like inbetween Clannad and OPM


PS: My review's readers, I know I'm heavily biased but I would like people to see the relaxing qualities of the anime, not focusing on the bad ones as you may see it. Thanks for reading!

Why he going to be adventurer, what is adventurer, and what his main resolve.

(I dont want to put spoiler bruh)
