For turn off your brain and just watch. Maybe you gonna like this beacuse everything gonna be fine and flat, even my feeling is hollow and not react to any should be heart-warming moment or intense scene. Even the joke and normal behavior are cringe and awkward.

You gonna be like: 'haHAA', 'WutFace', and 'cmonBruh' (google image it).

This series can hook my interest but execution, production quality and happy go lucky is really 'Bad' quality.

Enjoyment and directing = 3


Conclusion is 'Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni' may be your choice for entertain and killing time purpose (but still bad too), not for amazing or heavy material story.


I not recommending you to watch this anime because everything in this anime seems bad and worthless. Unless you come just because the harem fantasy.  Final score = 3

Sigh, after taking a quick glance through the reviews for this series I have to say people are being quite harsh on Isekai wa Smartphone. The majority of reviews I've seen have all been 1's, 2's, or 3's. And sure, this anime might not be anything to write home about. In all actuality I would consider it generic trash; however the point I'm trying to make is that being generic trash is perfectly fine. 
Let's take a looksie at the overall anime as a whole. From the scores I've given the anime on story, art, sound, and character the overall score should be a 5and not the 7 you currently see, but let's start my rant now.


Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni is a generic Isekai anime about some teenager dying and getting sent to another world; a trope that has been done to death recently. 

The real twist this anime has to offer thought is that what made me actually enjoy this anime was the fact it was so generic. With the current abundance of anime about travelling to another, and each company trying to wrap the anime to put their own niche twist it was heartening to see an anime not give a shit about that and just be normal. 

Don't get me wrong the anime isn't good, but it gave me the same feeling as if I was watching Rosario+Vampire. Generic and because of this normalcy I could turn off my brain and enjoy the simplicity the show had to offer.


Overall the show is a 5, normal and plain. However I have given the rating a 7 because it's nice to every once in a while let go and watch something without caring.

The best way to describe this anime is "safe."  Not safe for work (and hopefully far less safe for work on BD release) because there is always the obligatory harem anime fanservice, but it's a safe bet that if you don't come in expecting to think, you'll be able to stay for the ride and enjoy yourself.  
No thought necessary here, just instant, easy, predictable gratification.  The girls meet every checklist you could want from deadpan to impish to tsundere and beyond.  The animation is sparse but well accomplished: nothing too fancy, but no disappointments either.  Some slight character developmenttoward the end, but nothing that will anger anybody because it took a daring direction. Some characters seem almost-aware that the whole situation is ridiculous: "I'm not surprised anymore" (or some variation) is a frequently-used line.


Honestly, you could probably watch without sound and as long as you paid attention it would  still make sense.  The very opening of the first episode explains everything you need to know: God accidentally smites your stereotypical, thick-as-a-nuclear-bunker harem protagonist, and to make it up he sends Protag to a stereotypical high-fantasy world with massively OP magical abilities and a smartphone that never runs out of signal or power.

Ok let's be serious right now, we all know that this show isn't really that bad, to a extent most of the plot revolves around the MC getting to increase his harem and solving some problems that may or may not be related to his actual harem.
Story: its not that big of a deal if you think about it, random guy just died and then got to reincarnate with the option to bring something of his liking to this new world, and what does he choose? HIS SMARTPHONE. (just another day in the isekai genre)
Animation: pretty meh, the characters are nice enough, and you don'tactually find yourself disgusted from bad animation, sometimes it feels kind strange because of course most of the work is put into the PLOT (if you know what I am saying) and the environment isn't really detailed but nothing to complain in my opinion.


Soundtrack/Sound Effects: the opening and the ending are nice enough, they aren't something that you want to listen everyday but it is quite nice and really gets you going to see what will happen next on the adventure. when it comes to actual sound effects it's really what you would expect from a show with not that high of a budget, it's not bad, it's only super mediocre.


Characters: all the female cast have their own traits and personality that is inspired bad cliches we are very familiar with, and some of us have even found to actually enjoy them, for exemple: A cute timid girl with short hair and for some reason talks very politely, a tomboyish girl with long hair that acts mostly like a tsundere, your avarege everyday loli, your samurai cosplay referencing the Edo period and stuff like that. As for our main character we can see that he just does things as he likes, he is quite overpowered, he has a harem and everyone seems to fall in love with him just for the sake of it, but still he is quite nice to have as a main character because he isn't a perverted mastermind that humiliates his foes, he is just a guy that seems to be playing a game for 10 years straight and is enjoying his experience playing it once again.


Enjoyment: I loved this show, it's a generic harem isekai with pretty good comedy, it's great to watch if you are doing a trip or you are tired of your everyday stress, the show doesn't really take itself serious and I guess that's why it is so cool, you will love and probably shipp one of the main 5 girl with the main character, and it's nice to see that a problem that would probably impossible is solved in a matter of second, which leads to every new episode be able to have it's separate beauty from the others. I think  that that the reason why so many people hate this anime is because they just take it too serious and don't relax and enjoy all the cliches we all learned to love with all these years.

The typical fantasy 'Isekai" plot that every anime fans would expect - OP main character, MC adapting to the fantasy world, gathering reliable allies for battle and completing quests, using the wits and knowledge from his world to unleash his capabilities in the new world and of course, gathering harem. 
When I read the plot, first thing came to my mind is the mediocre typical setting that many other series have attempted before. I came to a conclusion that there are nothing special or appealing about this anime. However, I decided to give both myself and "Isekai wa Samartphone to Tomo ni" a chance andattempted a few episodes.


The first episode was decent but I am not very pleased with the anime artwork. It feels like a low cut budget production that the art was just dreadful. Plot wise - The MC, Touya Mochizuki were given priority and special skills that would even rival the king. Touya was able to equip all of the magic elements and inherit the legacy of the ancient civilisation - something that even a high ranking magic practitioner can barely do that. Hence, you can say that Touya has the whole world in his hands. 


What I hate most about this series is that there isn't any solid plot, Touya and his allies were just consistently defeating enemies, earning the trusts of Kings from various state and thus, adding more girls into his "harem" collection- YAY. Moreover, all he does is the SAME old deadly move to capitalise his opponent. There isn't any suspense or thrill in watching him defeat his opponent as you know that he will always easily overthrow them with that 1 godly move. 


If you are those who just want to seek a light hearted, comedy, action with slice of life theme, this is just for you but there are MANY more better anime than this. On the other hand, if you are a hardcore action anime fan that would like to seek epic anime fights, then this will disappoint you. 


Overall, it's mediocre and overrated.

I am giving this show a 7.  However, let me clarify that this score is not a literal 7.  It is a NEGATIVE 7.  This show is not the kind that you watch to have a fulfilling experience, it is the kind of show that you sit down to watch with a snack and a nice bottle of pumpkin-spice bleach.
To its credit, I can nearly guarantee that this show will surprise you somehow.  At some point during your watching experience, you will almost certainly say "there's no way they'd do something that obvious", and at another time think "surely they won'tjust randomly trivialize this conflict that they hyped up so much" and then, of course, they do.  Then you will think "at least it can't possibly get any worse.", and then it does.  This show is shocking in its sheer boringness, and it will almost certainly keep you on the edge of your seat waiting to see just how it'll manage to screw up this time.


To conclude this review, I will now provide the empirical mathematical formula for the creation of this show:


Smartphone = Eromanga-Sensei + Isekai - FBI.  (Note that the lack of the FBI is solely a function of being in an alternate universe where the FBI does not exist, and that the main female love interest is still 12 years old.)

This is your classic protagonist gets transfer to another world and becomes overpowered.
I know this anime isn't for everyone and as a person who hasn't read the light novel but lets be honest here we all know this is basically bad but if you're into the same old Dense OP protagonist who accidentally makes a harem the this is for you and you would enjoy this. 
And if you're not into that kind of crap then this anime is basically like any trash you have seen in the past years. 
Starting from the characters is that they are all you're typical cliche characters in aharem there is little character development or if not none. 


the sound is pretty good thats one of the things you could enjoy.


the animation is basically i wouldn't terrible but i wouldn't say good its on a neutral position as you can see the laziness of the animator but you would still enjoy some of it.


The Story so far to me is not appealing as its basically just any other isekai story but it has a sense of like its trying to be different from any other isekai anime but the feeling of it is that you would notice that they are about to give up on that and just be another isekai anime which i hope they don't. The concept of it is kinda weird which basically normal for anime but if this your first time watching this kind of anime then this isn't for you.


The Overall of this is a solid 7 you would enjoy this but not to the point you could say this is a great anime. This anime was made by studio reed and we know Studio reed isn't going well in the anime industry. And finally i would recommend this anime to a person who likes any other harem and just basically loves the genre but to a normal anime fan i would not recommend this.

I have to say first off that most of the time I end up skipping nearly 60% of the episode, its rare for me to be able to watch an entire episode. But, i do watch the entire episode from this anime. I have to say i rather like it.
Having said that it really isn't for everyone. It's super cliche and the main character is way op, plus all of the girls are basically just stereo-typical anime girls without much substance. Also, there really doesn't seem to be a real story line or goal for the main character. In my opinion, if you have aop main character he has to have some grand goal he's working towards but there just doesn't seem to be one. Also the completely oblivious to all the girls feelings is....overplayed to say to least. \n
Again, i actually like this anime, it's one of maybe 2 series that i can sit through an entire episode this season, but it's not new or particularly well written.

So, another Isekai anime, we all know where this is going to go.
With an overpowered MC which had vastly similar character designs as Kirito from SAO and of course, like SAO we have the harem.
There’s nothing really to the plot, I might even say there is no plot at all!
The progress of this anime from every episode is the building of the MC’s harem and fandom in the kingdom I don’t even see how this anime makes it for the romance tag with the female characters all falling for him on first sight or at least tagging along with him and ‘slowly’ falling for himwith even a 12 year old princess requesting for marriage!


Not to say the character designs are shitty, it’s not. It’s just vastly generic and mainstream with something like SAO and like a poor downgraded copy of KonoSuba... and we all know KonoSuba was just for fan service to get more people to read the manga. That speaks a lot of this anime. But I got to admit there are a few character designs that intrigue me like the girl with a sharp tooth like a vampire sorta...the mystic eyes girl and the girl that always ends her sentence with ‘gozaru’ which of course is trying to mimic Rurouni Kenshin’s speech style. Kms the girl in Isekai Smartphone that talks like Kenshin is also a fking Samurai


The voice acting to also quite cute, everyone in his harem and the 12 yr old princess that is about to marry him too.


You should probably watch if you’re craving for some harem anime that you’ll not get emotionally attached and with every harem anime there is of course the fan service.


TL;DR

Slime scene

Hot girls and loli

A pet tiger that is used as a stress ball

OP MC

Did you like Konosuba? This show did but, I don't think it did that on purpose. There are just a lot of similarities between the two.  Our main character dies because God screwed up so in return because god can't send him back to his world, he sends him to a world filled with magic and hot girls. He even makes him the Avatar of that world as he can use all the elements. But before he goes God says he can bring one thing with him to this new world and Touya (main character) chooses his smartphone. Now, this might make you skepticalbut in reality, it was genius. He has access to our internet in this world, so he has all our knowledge. He can make and sell stuff for a fortune but... he doesn't do that and really only uses the phone when it is convenient like it just a normal tool and doesn't capitalize on it much. its a really good story arc and there are many things like Konosuba I won't mention here but its like they are trying to make references whenever they can.


The art is great. character designs I guess are a little bland but nothing to fault it for. I can't think of much other than that to point out but there is a lot of show left and budgets can run thin.


The sound is great. nothing too memorable but it is certainly not bad. I'm sure a lot of people can really get into the music and voice acting.


The characters are alright. They suit the story well but don't add much to it. it kinda just going with the flow and they don't walk out their tropes much. character designs are good but nothing too special. no one is going to end up being your favorite character but I think you will like them well enough.


overall, I'm loving it so far but that just might be the Konosuba reference blinding me to more flaws. definitely, give it a watch 7/10 but it might drop considerably as we go, this genre can be a little risky with so much in it.

A perfectly watchable "other world" anime with good character design and all the usual tropes. However, the main character is given godlike abilities right out of the gate so why even bother with the smartphone nonsense? They should have picked one or the other.
Because of the main characters overwhelming ability to do practically anything, there isn't much drama or tension in each episode so far. Even with his female companions, there is no chemistry since he his perfectly nice all of the time.
You will have to be a real fan of the genre to stick this one out, if not then there are much betteroptions available in the "other world" category.

[SPOILERS FROM FIRST EPISODE]
This anime is one of those when the main character gets transported into a new world. Now this isnt a problem, since i myself really like this genre, but the execution is terrible to begin with. To be honest i watch this anime, but only because im used to the genre being good and enjoyable, and because there arent pretty much anime this season.
Lets get to the points that bother me the most;
-Main character:
So, the fact that he gets a smartphone to an other world is okay, now he gets maximum magical power, this gave me satisfaction for some reason, i likeOP characters, and from this point there are really exciting possibilities for character development. BUT the biggest flaw of the anime comes now - The main character's personality is exactly NOTHING. He is like a talking bag of potatoes, he has nothing original, nothing to remember of. He is like ,,-Oh okay.", does the same as an average person would do, but that average person still would have more personality anyways.


-Transportation

When Touya dies, and talks to the god he is too calm to be real. I know its anime but its almost as he wanted to die, he is that ,,Oh okay" guy again. I know this is because the no-personality too but at least they would have made him be mad or freaked out there.


Overall what i hate: The fact that this world would have so many possibilities but they dont use it.



I havent use any of that salty critisism while writing this review, this comes straight from my heart (xD)


Anyways, i'll be keep on watching because im bored and i want to see if that lack of personality there will get fixed in some way, maybe the meaning of the mc wearing a white jacket has something to do with being empty and eventually he will show development or whatever.

This is my first review so please bear with me.
Story:
This is the biggest problem. The author basically thought that having a shit ton of girls, a dumb as fuck mc and a bunch of unrelated problems is a great story. Every arc starts with, "Oh shit, someone is in danger. I'm going to help them!" There was even an arc where the mc just wipes the fuck out of an army in one shot. It's not even showy. Just one spell like an average day and done. Absolutely horrible. I would rant more but it's not worth the time. Giving it a 1.
Art and Sound:
Can'tcomplain. The anime in general was animated well. It's the story that's shit. However, it's not exactly the best. The lines are much rougher and is just a typically average animation. I'm giving it a 5 for average.\n\n
Character:\n
All the girls swoon for the mc for no fucking reason. One second into meeting him and they're already asking for his dick. The main character has overpowered abilities which is typical, but he is essentially a slave who does whatever someone asks. He has no will of his own except solving other people's problems. Literally, the anime would be better if we just delete the mc and replace it with a talking phone or something. All in all, I give the character a 1.\n\n
Enjoyment:\n
If you like a predictable storyline, a dumb as fuck slave main character, no progression in any fashion anime, then this is enjoyable. I literally only enjoy watching it because it is an anime and nothing else. So I give it a 2 because it is animated and the girls are cute.\n\n
Overall:\n
It is absolutely dreadful. I really don't see anything good. But because the studio that made it was decent and all the negatives are basically because of the story and the original source, I can't give it a 1. So I'll give it a 2.

In a world that got ruled by smartphones and stupid people, we got blessed with an anime called 'Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni.' or in English 'In Another World with my Smartphone' (Summer 2017). This anime is a good example we have reached our peak of human civilistation and we're now heading towards our downfall. Pack your bags folks, it's over. 
I only started watching this anime as a joke because of all the negatieve reviews and I already had low expectations judging by the synopsis and the title alone. I better should taken those revieuws seriously and saved about 4 hours of mylife watching this pile of trash. Yes, I've seen a couple good 'isakai anime' before this (Konosuba & How Not To Summon A Demon Lord; don't @ me if you don't agree.) and I hate to say it I've seen now this pile of polished dog shit. You better recharge your smartphone before you're reading this, because this revieuw won't contain any bullshit 'Recovery' magic to save your ass and heal you for being injured from my negativity.


Story: 2/10 (Horrible)

Our 15 year old main charather accidentally died by a lighting strike. But it's OK, because "God" said sorry. That's for now the most half-assed 'Isakai anime' introduction I've ever seen. But it's alright people, because the first thing that our MC thought about was "Hey, can I use my smartphone?" when he was told to he can get a second chance. No shock about realizing you're dead, no crying you never going to see your family or friends again. Nope, just like all those other smartphone zombies you see in real-life that are glued on thier smartphone the first thing they think about is there precious stupid smartphone. But it's OK, because he will get revived another world with his smartphone. ROLL THE CREDITS! Yeah, that's our story pretty much summed up. It's just a bummer they actully made up that his smartphone will recharge magically, becauyse they knew a battery lifespan of a smartphone battery endurence in 2017 is only for on average 5 days if you don't use the damn thing. Atleast the writers probably knew beforehand this anime would get trashed by a lot of people anyway, so I give them props for that for trolling us. Yes, Studio Production Reed, I'm mad bro. The overall story really didn't made an impact on me.


Art: 3/10 (Very Bad)

There were times I really questioned myself that I really saw that animation error or not or was I just tripping balls out of my mind like I normally do? Yeah, I probably did. Some charathers are even so badly designed that you get PTSD from our own cringy Western cartoons and this is not even over-exaggerated. Did I mention they even like to re-use animations every now and then? No? Well, they do and I'm glad I've noticed that. I can say, it's OK for me to re-use animations if you animate a meccha show for transformation purposes etc. just like they did in the much older 'Beast Wars II' (1998), but for a show like this it really cost them positive points from me if you tell me. The animators probably didn't cared about this anime iether and rather wanted this to be a short series instead or wanted to work on something different and I can't blame them. What the animators did care however was the inevitable fan service episode (episode 10). It really felt the quality of the animation increased. Who would have guessed it? The two last episodes however the quality just went down again in degencery. You can see the inevitable beach episode as a reward with the fact you're almost done with this anime. But it doesn't mean if the beach episode was done a bit better, the whole show becomes good...


Sound: 5/10 (Average)

So uh, the sound? It's passable I guess? Atleast I can say nothing really negatieve about the sound. It's just that I don't really like the opening song and I would have liked to hear a much better suited opening song, but that's just me. The background music that gets used is nice and gives you a positieve atmosphere and I can really appriciate it, because that's pretty much the best part of this whole anime. Sadly, with the sweet background music alone this won't save this anime for being a turd. Afterall, a polished turd is still a turd.


Charather: 2/10 (Horrible)

Yeah, you really think I was going to be positieve about this anime it's charathers, think again sunshine. Without the blessing of "God" and the writers, our main charather would probably have been deceased already in the very first 8 minutes of the first episode because of his cringy attitude. He's THAT useless of a main charather, yet he got assigned to be overpowered by the blessing of the writers because MC sakes. He's that of a cringy 15 year old protagonist with a smartphone. When I used to be 15 year old myself, I still played with the LEGO's and I wasn't even allowed to have a cellphone because my parants atleast tried to raise me well even when mobile cellphones already were already a big thing back then. Standards and morals really does have changed. The only charather I really liked was the cute tiger-kitty, but that's because I like seeing cute things because I'm a moe blob piece of shit. As for the female charathers I really can't understand they all want a piece of our 15 year old smartphone addict that's been blessed by "God" and the writers. But then again; I have to blame the writers for this one forcing us a harem romance story after all down our troats, so yeah, go figure. Probably the writers hated themselves for not being praised on social media or something. In overall the charathers are pretty forgetable if you ask me.


Enjoyment: 2/10 (Horrible)

You really think I enjoyed this anime? I had to take a break every 5 minutes by watching the very first epsiodes. It's that boring and bad really. I tried many methods in order in maybe to find any hidden enjoyment while going trough this anime series, but I failed to enjoy this anime in pretty much in any aspect. But I managed to get trough it and that's something and I guess that's an accomplishment on it's own. Can I have a pat on my back? Pretty please? No? Awwwww... A headpat is fine too.


Overall: 3/10 (Very Bad)

In overall, this is a very bad anime and the negatives outweighs the positieves for sure. Unless you can stomach the forced harem romance bullshit that's been done way too much already, the boring 15 year old MC with his cringy attitude, the lack of a good plot, sometimes a very questionable art-style by modern standards, ... I really don't recommend it. Unless you're a bit of a masochist, then sure, have fun dude or gal that's reading this. I'm not judging you. Been there & done that myself. I've sat trough this anime myself mainly for masochist purposes. This anime really failed so badly that this anime becomes a huge pile of polished dog-shit sprinkled by other trash and it got shoved down our troats and they really expect you to swallow it like how you would eat a cinnamon roll. To think this anime is already one year old when I'm writing this and still manages to have an average mean by 6,77 on MAL when I wrote ths is beyond me wich I still see as high. Maybe it's just me for having a bad taste in anime or it is just that a lot of users of this site really have lost touch with reality and are no point in saving when shit really hits the fan. In my view, this show is the worst anime show of 2017 so far I have seen. I can even proudly say and admit I even enjoyed the anime shorts 'Aho Girl' (2017) & 'Yo! Daitouryou Trap-kun' (2017) a bit more compaired with this pile of trash. If you really want to see an 'isakai anime' and enjoy yourself, go watch 'Konosuba' (2016) for entertainment or 'How Not to Summon A Demon Lord' (2018) for your ecchi-fix instead. You'll get much more worth of entertainment with those for your time investment.


TL;DR "Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni." gets from me an overall score of 3/10 and yes, it's a very bad anime. Don't watch it, unless for for masochist purposes. I'm not judging you.

Thoughts on "In Another World With My Smartphone" (some spoilers so be warned):
Just when isekai felt like it couldn't get any worse or more repetitive, the least original or interesting anime I have ever seen came along to prove to me that yes, it IS possible to be worse than Death March. 
Once again the series follows a bland, personality-free guy from our world who is thrown into a video-game-like fantasy world with some quirk that makes him ridiculously overpowered to the point that there is never any real threat to him, and once again he assembles a large harem of women who all fallin love with him despite his complete lack of personality, goals, ideals, etc. What makes this show "different" is that in this show he has his smartphone with him, since he is allowed to keep it in the new world by God at the start of the series (yes, a bizarre adaptation of the Judeo-Christian God is a recurring character in this show)… Oh wait, having a smartphone in a parallel world and claiming that it’s a magical item is NOT an original concept for an isekai, since it was already done in Oda Nobuna No Yabou. Unlike Oda Nobuna however, which has stunning animation and a superb soundtrack, this series has bland visuals with mediocre to subpar animation (inexplicably by the former 1990’s action mega-studio Production Reed nonetheless) and no memorable pieces of music whatsoever. So, the premise is unoriginal, and the visual presentation is bland… and it only gets worse from there. Since the protagonist is the only person in his world (until the final episode) who is able to use every kind of magic in existence, there is never any tension and he never has to put any kind of effort into solving any of the problems in the show, making all of them feel boring and uninteresting. To make up for this, the show has one admittedly cool zombie arc in the middle that amps up the tension, but it just feels out of place in terms of tone, and after that arc amps up the stakes, the stakes quickly disappear afterwards when the story changes to a fanservicey beach-arc.\n
The show’s setting looks exactly like every single other isekai show lately in terms of building design and the existence of magical guilds (which are themselves not properly explained in this show), and there’s just no creativity in any of the character designs or background designs. Everything just looks like ~17th Cenury housing with medieval technology levels and bland costume designs.\n
Anyway, out of nowhere part way through the series, a robot waifu living on a flying garden is introduced seemingly just for the sake of adding awkward innuendos to the story, but the worst thing about it is that she looks exactly the same as Milinda from Heavy Object, right down to her hairstyle, colour-scheme and facial structure. The guys were so lazy that they couldn’t even be bothered to come up with a different girl design, and just copied someone else’s with minimal change at all. And speaking of copying other series, you know how in Type Moon, some characters have powers referred to as “Mystic Eyes” (e.g. Mystic Eyes of Death Perception, Mystic Eyes of Petrification, etc.) Well that was ripped off in this show, as one of the girls has the power of Mystic Eyes of Personality Perception (they even ripped off the word perception), a power which causes her to instantly fall in love with the protagonist.\n
The story itself is extremely slow-paced, with virtually nothing happening throughout most of the episodes, and when stuff with world-altering implications does get set up instead of focusing the story on those elements, all we get are distractions that focus on bringing the lead and the girls closer together, which is problematic for several reasons: All of the girls have exactly the same personality (even the girl who is set up as more shy than her sister at the start ends up acting exactly the same as her when the show ends). Some of the girls are underage, including the one who becomes his fiancée first, who is freaking 12 years old! But don’t worry about that, since we learn in the final episode that social norms from our world don’t apply in the fantasy world and that as soon as he turns 18 he can marry as many waifus as he wants since apparently polygamy is normal in that world too, and the woman who can see the future says that he will have 9 wives while the camera pans out to show all 9 of the show’s main female characters, some of whom are still children, which is gross! Oh, and you know how in SAO and Grimgar all of the characters go through emotional turmoil as a result of their transplantation and worry about the people they’ve left behind? Not in this show, the protagonist never once seems to care about his family or anyone at all special in the old world. Heck, we learn literally nothing bout who he was before going in the fantasy setting, and he has no personality built onto him by the end! Everything about this show is terrible even by the standard of bad isekais.\n
Then there’s the problem with the show’s theology. It’s made abundantly clear that God (singular) exists in the show, and is even a character… but then in the final episode, they introduce us to another character referred to as the “Goddess of love”, despite the previously stated monotheistic nature of the show’s universe. How can he be God (singular) if there are other gods? Why is her origin not explained at all? AAAAARGH!\n
It’s unoriginal, slow-paced, boring, forgettable, and apparently it’s getting a second season (at least according to a lot of the comments on the funimation page for the last episode).\n
Why is trash like this worthy of a second season, while great series like Trinity Blood and Deadman Wonderland get nothing? 0/10, not recommended unless you are a masochist.\n

I'll start out by saying that this anime isn't for people who dislike the Isekai trend in anime. I would say that it could be considered 'Isekai trash' from those who don't enjoy Isekai anime. But from someone who has found much enjoyment in them, I would have to say that it is one of the better ones. I love the characters that for the most part carry the show but I also get a bunch of enjoyment out of the show.
Story: 7, Good
 The story isn't really anything special up until the end where it seems to take some kind of 180 but justbecause the story isn't that special it's relatively charming. I went into this show saying to myself "only in Japan would they make a show about a guy going to another world with a smartphone" and expecting it to be really campy but I was pleasantly surprised when it wasn't. The show took its story somewhat seriously but not too much and I found myself laughing at the outlandishness of every time the main character found some new overpowered way to function and use his magic. It was a little crazy but it was extremely fun and exciting to watch. The story never relied too much on suspense but I don't think a good story has to. The pacing is pretty good overall and it was just fun to watch it progress.


Art: 7, Good

There isn't much to say here. The art isn't bad and I'd say it is at least above average. Each character feels distinct in their art styles and as though I'd recognize them out of context and I don't think it looks too samey to other anime from the studio.


Sound: 7, Good

It is the relative same here, between the sound effects and the voice acting I never really found myself taken out of the world by it. Each voice actor does a good job at portraying their character and the sound effects in the show, while they may not stand out among other shows, are still good nonetheless and do their job which isn't something that can be said about a great number of other anime.


Character: 9, Great

I love the characters in this show. Every time I go into an Isekai show I expect some cut-out character for the MC and so far I haven't actually found that. The MC Touya having a personality of calmness, not because he is overpowered, but because that was the way he was raised, especially in the beginning scenes, stands out making you think he would have to be some kind of nice guy who is always calm. But adding the fact he is a "closet pervert" with a harem constantly surrounding him just gives him another layer that is often used for comedy but it makes him less 2-D. On top of Touya, each of the girls has their own personality (myself especially liking Sushie) that makes them shine without much overlap. Especially when considering characters like Sushie, Yumina, Leen, and Yae who have their own backstories it makes them feel real and makes you want to root for them and their own personal goals. Supporting characters like Kohaku and the King and his brother always are extremely fun to watch on screen. Characters like Alfred are extremely lovable beyond that of other supporting characters just because they exude personality.


Enjoyment: 10, Outstanding

This is the one category that I believe to be completely subjective. And I loved every moment of the show that I watched it. Character interactions, how just OP Touya is, the formation of his Harem, the cliffhanger at the end, everything was right down my alley. Maybe that's why I score this so high compared to others, it just comes down to the enjoyment of not only Isekai, but the more looked-down upon genres in anime like the harem genre. Everything just fits together perfectly for me and to somewhat go off of Nux Taku, Isekai is the perfect genre because it can literally be anything, and still be relatable because it is so easy to contextualize. On top of that, I love seeing cool characters do cool things using their powers, I enjoyed SAO and many other shows with an overpowered main character that does cool things for reasons like this.


Overall while I can see why people that dislike the idea of somewhat trashy Isekai/Harem anime, I think if you like either you will like this show.

So, let's get this out of the way first: This show is a trash tier level Isekai anime.
If it's trash, why still rank it at 6 overall? Well, let me tell you...
Even with the horribly bland, cliched power trip fantasy world setting, equally bland main character and equally horrible supporting cast, Trapped in Another World with my Smartphone still manages to be funny, like to the point that I think it might have been originally pitched as a parody show on the Isekai genre similar to Konosuba. 
I'm writing this review months after originally watching the show and somehow I'm remembering it with a levelof fondness I didn't think was possible for something so bad on the surface. It has all the marks of a bad, trend chasing anime: Overpowered main character, who despite having no charm, ends up with a harem of adoring fan girls, check. Isekai, check. Lazy/low budget art, check. blah blah blah, rant rant rant, you know a bad anime when you see one.\n
Now, what makes the show great? It takes the general Isekai tropes and very unironically takes them to levels of trash I didn't think existed. In fact, it looks like it's done so intentionally and with such seriousness, I'm afraid it's actually above me. The show is just one knowing look into the camera away from becoming a satire that could be amazing and I'd be pretty sad if this was the original intent and it just was never portrayed in the anime.\n
Go into this anime with the knowledge that it's bad, but tell yourself it's bad on purpose and you'll have a great time. Once you're done, go watch a good satire of the Isekai genre: Konosuba, and realize how close this was to greatness.\n
A+ for imagined effort\n
F for execution\n
In the wise words of Gigguk, anime is trash and so am I

I'd like to start my review by telling you to not read the reviews rating this anime overall under 4. I rated this a 6, because I rate my anime on a scale of 1-10, not a scale of 6-10 like most of MAL. This anime is clearly not for those who watch anime to think critically, and is geared towards a viewer who's just looking to just enjoy watching an anime. This anime, while trash in it's character development and story, has a quite decent sound, and is very enjoyable, as while the main character is overpowered and the outcomes inherently predictable, it stillfinds a way to stay entertaining and enjoyable. Overall, since anime is a medium of entertainment, and this anime filled it's purpose of entertaining in my opinion, and made me feel a sort of sentimentality from a generic theme, with a bunch of the little things spiced up, I give it a 6.

so as for those who have commented already I hope you read up on the manga even just alittle bit to get a bigger picture of where they plan on going with this anime.

[THIS REVIEW MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS]
_____________________________________________________________________________________________
So this is my first ever review, so I'm sorry if it's kinda bland or short as of right now I don't know where to begin. So I chose something this recent anime season drudged out. Honestly, we have such a subpar anime that the term generic is too generous of a term for it. This piece of garbage that was splattered on my screen actually surprised me. I had heard good things about it from my friend who actually enjoys harems. Don't get me wrong, I love a good harem anime from time to time (who doesn't really). It surprisedme in a way that was, in plain terms stupid. It was so bad I could barely comprehend. The main focus of a harem anime should be the girls, and even then they could BARELY do a decent job at getting the girls to be likable. Enough pre ranting, onto the review!


Story (2)

Honestly, the story is bland and subpar, that calling it dreadful is an understatement. But let's start with the basics. A regular average joe is killed by God, God gives him another chance in a different world that looks like it was pulled right out of a crappy jrpg. The protagonist then learns he has a proficiency in all elements, goes onto becoming an overpowered hero. He then gets a group of girls for some contrived reason or another decides to follow him to the ends of the earth and each fall in love with him because he's essentially an all-powerful being in that world. That's pretty much it. There's actually an 'interesting' subplot, (interesting being used very loosely here as it's because it's better than the rest of the garbage that is called this anime), involving conspiracies and a giant airship but it goes unnoticed. It was instead just hinted at then shoved aside like it didn't matter, all so we can get to see the bland cardboard cutouts that they call its characters do stupid, meaningless garbage.


Character (2)

Talking about bland cardboard cutouts leads me to my second point, the characters. Now the characters in a standard harem should be its bread and butter, that is to say, it should be what the anime would want to be its main selling point. But instead, in Isekai wa Smartphone, we get these cutout characters who can barely convey any emotion besides lust towards the protagonist and shyness. This reminds me of a very poor visual novel. Let's start with the main twins. Of course in typical anime fashion, you have to have an outgoing twin and a shy twin because of course, you do. Next up we have the oriental Japanese samurai girl who's only characteristic is that she has a strong sense of morals. Then we have the princess who falls in love with the protagonist for what I see is like a contractual obligation she must fulfill if she wants her time in the spotlight. Honestly, those 4 are the only main ones you should have the need to focus on because they'll be the 4 you see the most of. I actually kinda enjoyed the fairy character, if she wasn't such an obvious S&M character. She at least had a more interesting power than the rest of them with the power to program objects like one would when programming a computer.


Art (4)

The art is decent, if you play with the word decent to make it mean just average. I really can't state any faults or things the art style does well. I mean I guess it fits the anime? (By being a literal dumpster fire). It's not the worst I've ever seen, but it's far from the best.


Sound (3)

Honestly, the sound engineering was bad, worse than average. The voice actors and actresses sound like they're disinterested like they couldn't care less to be there. They could've breathed life into the anime if they tried a few bit more, but I couldn't get into the characters thanks to their pitiful job.


Enjoyment (4)

I enjoyed the anime in the same sense it's enjoyable to watch someone bang their head against the wall until the wall either gives or their skull is caved in. Sure, it's interesting to look at and you might even get a few chuckles out of it from time to time, and is a great time waster if you have 6 hours you want to regret losing. But I don't think I'd ever watch it again. Nothing really stood out about the anime that I really cared about. The only reason it has a 4 is because when I was younger I would've loved this anime just because it was a harem. But it was a harem with no substance, something I find to be quite disheartening. I hope Japan hasn't forgotten how to make good harem anime's, like Date a Live.


Overall (3) 

Honestly, I reached 3 because I threw my numbers into my desktop calculator and out popped 3.something or another. Overall I would've personally given it a 1 or a 2, but at the time of writing it's been a few weeks since I've seen it and I can't remember anything enjoyable about it. I remember there was one part about it that elicited a chuckle from me, so that's something I guess. But I would never watch it again just to get to that one chuckle point. Just save yourself the trouble and go watch Konosuba or something else instead.


I hope you enjoyed my first ever anime review! I might do more when I have time. In the meantime, DON'T watch this anime, unless you're absolutely bored or retarded.

This was great. If you like anime where the main character is ridiculously overpowered, in such a way it's comparable to Sword Art Online or Is It Okay To Pick Up Girls In A Dungeon?!, then this will likely be something you can enjoy. It's a feel-good type of series that can have you smiling or laughing all the way through.

Warning possible Spoilers
After the spring season this year, I had high hopes that Eromanga-Sensei would remain my worst anime of 2017, then I decided to watch "In another world with my smartphone" and oh boy was it pure trash.
Story (3/10)
Now if you've watched as many harems as I have, then you'll know the story won't be impressive, true there are some that are pretty good (Like HS DxD or Haganai), but this was just cliched as hell.
The story follows our MC Touya Mochizuki, who died and by the powers of God he ended up in a fantasy world along with his smartphone, there he meetsa lot of female characters, does some adventures with them and everything else a harem anime does, you pretty much get the gist at this point.

The story is ball's, it never goes anywhere other than Touya growing his harem over time, the show thought combining Re:Zero, SAO and Konosuba would make it fantastic when really it's just a jumbled mess.

Whenever something slightly interesting happened it was just blown away by more cliches, most of the time I was just bored especially with how the situations were handled, it surprised me how ridiculously easy it was for our characters to get past them, which the show lost all of it's thrill and intensity from me.

I will admit though, when it got to the final two episodes I was completely blown away how the show did a complete 180 on me, like the first 10 episodes were just boring as hell, then these final two episodes brought out an enjoyment that the show was missing the whole time, hell they even got rid of many cliches that hold back a lot of harems, this surprised and angered me at the same time because if they had started the show like this, then it might not have been so bad and could've been tolerable.

However the ending just completely annoys me even more, because this show thinks it deserves a season 2 and I pray to the anime Gods that this will never happen.


Characters (4/10)


Most of the characters were either bland or really forgettable, but there were a few hidden gems, sadly though they were introduced later on in the series.

Touya is the MC, it's funny how I thought Ichika from Infinite Stratos was dense as fu*k, but this guy really takes the cake, because he was absolutely awful I couldn't get behind him as a character, plus they tried giving him Saitama op levels, but it made me hate him even more, because of how lucky and stupid the outcomes were.

Linze and Elze Silhoueska are the first girls he meets, probably the blandest of the female characters, these two are you're usual cliched twins, one's a Tsundere while the other is a Dandere, although I'll give some credit for their personalities sometimes being swapped around showing a different side to their characters.

Yae Kokonoe is a girl from the Japanese like place called Iishen, a typical samurai girl, she was average although I liked how despite being a fearsome fighter she was clumsy and a bit of a gluten, however she felt alright for like one episode before the other characters showed up.

Yumina Urnea Belfast is the forced marriage cliche girl of the show, despite being named after the capital of Northern Ireland, she was actually an ok character I enjoyed her company in the show, then you realise she's 12 years old making you having to avoid a SWAT coming in and breaking down you're door.

Sushie Urnea Ortlinde is Yumina's cousin, despite being a main character, she really wasn't in the show all that much and it's a good thing too, because she was absolutely annoying as hell, I don't think I could've handled this show if her role was bigger.

Leen is a 600 or so year old fairy, despite being the final main girl to be introduced the amount of screentime she had was great, definitely one of the better characters, Leen was a bit of a surprise as she likes to be assertive, but playful too which leads to some pretty funny situations.

I also have to mention Francesca, who was introduced during the final episodes, stole the whole show for me, mainly because she kept saying dirty jokes to the MC even though she's some kind of cyborg who was built 5000 years ago, but her presence in the show was well received by me.


Art (3/10)


The artstyle was pretty damn poor, mainly because the locations looked boring and empty, I would also say the characters look kinda detailed, but the fact that Linze and Elze looked almost like Kyou and Ryou from Clannad along with Francesca looking like Mira from Dimension W was definitely fishy and didn't seem as creative when I thought about it.


Sound (3/10)


The op and ed were not very enjoyable, they just felt generic and never really gained my attention, same can be said for the soundtrack too, although it's very rare with harem anime's having good soundtracks, ops and eds anyway, so I wasn't holding my breath on this one.


Extras:


The whole fantasy setting was also quite lackluster, despite some interesting features with the magic, it wasn't really that amazing considering how easy it was to cast spells and other stuff, plus there wasn't that much when it came to having diverse races as there was only humans and cat people along with Leen being the only fairy in the show, but that's it.

The comedy was bland as hell, it never made me laugh or even chuckle, that's how tedious this was, until the final two episodes which suddenly started making me laugh outta nowhere which surprised me entirely.

The harem and romance aspects of this show are probably the most surprising parts of the show, despite being full of cliches it gets rid of the most common cliche in any harem anime and that's infighting, usually the female characters always argue with each other yet here that doesn't happen, instead the girls make a pact with each other so that they would all agree to marry Touya and despite his denseness, Touya actually manages to get further into his relationship with the girls than most harem MC's, because he actually kisses all of them and even agrees to marry all of them which is something that completely surprised me, so despite being a boring show, there are a few surprises.


Enjoyment (3/10)


Overall (3/10)


Overall this show has been the worst anime so far this year and considering it's November now, I doubt I'll find an anime worse than this by the years end, but you never know.

This was basically a cheap konosuba ripoff. But it was actually really good. It was surprising how many cliches they managed to avoid when making this, which alone made it worth watching. The plot was semi-interesting although it did get a bit cliche towards the end. Not a deep anime, in fact it's kind of shallow. Not necessarily a good first anime, but one does get tired of the same old same old eventually.
This anime parodies a parody (konosuba) which is kind of impressive in its own right. They make that pretty obvious from the start, concluding with "explosion!" although the anime develops its ownplot in a unique way. The art leaves a lot to be desired and it's obvious this anime was done on a budget, but apart from the cheap spell effects to the point of being corny there isn't really much I can say negative about it.

Have you ever tasted a dish so bland that you know if the chef only added more spices, herbs or any other aromatics it would make it hella better?
This is the precise problem of the show. It is bland. It is tasteless. It is insipid. There is nothing remotely interesting to keep you going. Just the occasional small dishes of fanservices and interesting plot development.
But when you really want to savor the development, wondering what it would become and maybe, just maybe it becomes something amazing. It just gets shot down by the overall tasteless entree known as Isekai wa Smartphone.
※ Strength ※
- Concept. NowI have to say the concept itself is very interesting and attracts a lot of attention. This anime reminds me of KonaSuba for the first few episodes but fails to even touch the minimum level of that god tier anime. You have all these amazing ideas and it sucks to see it all going down to the drain because of poor executions.

- Hype. I certainly felt this during various moments in the anime. It isn't completely boring as the transition of plot keeps it somewhat interesting that you might be hoping the show may take another turn, perhaps for the better. So many hype moments but so many let downs.

- Harem. If you are a fan of multiple girls flock over one guy for whatever ridiculous reason, this show definitely shows that multiple time.


※ Weakness ※

- Boring. When a show repeats itself in terms of plot development, you have a sense of what's going to happen next. It really was boring to a certain degree that I can't help but gradually close my eyes.

- Lack of personality. It went downhills around mid-way, the girls only serve as basically objectified sex appeals to the MC. The only thing those girls have for them is visual appeal, nothing more, nothing less.

- Predictable. We all know that somehow the MC will save everyone with his super god-given power that he somehow gets for his favoritism that isn't even explained. Every hype moment is predictable because we know no "good guys" will die.


Would I rewatch? Hell no.

Would I recommend? If you want to waste time on an inferior harem genre.

Are you sad? Somewhat. If the plot was garbage to begin with, then it's understandable. But given that this had potential. It's quite traumatic for a viewer to realize that the show had literally committed suicide due to stupidity.


This show could have gone the KonoSuba route. This show could have had a stronger, powerful MC with a real backbone. This show could have been darker and had the MC take over the world. This show could have been filled with action, drama, rom com, psychology and so much more.


But in the end, what is done is done. 


It's nothing more than just a typical average harem anime that will be forgotten within 2 weeks.

At this point the prospect of another isekai anime is greeted with a mixture of bemusement or a loud collective groan by the anime community at large. Ever since the concept was popularized by the likes of Sword Art Online, nearly every season has seen at least one take on it. Derided by detractors as nothing more than wish fulfillment for otakus, the space for isekai played straight has shrunk to almost nothing. In this it parallels the trajectory of battle harems, another brief staple of the anime scene that has largely faded away. It’s telling that two of the most popular isekai stories inrecent memory, Konosuba and Re:Zero, are a parody and deconstruction, respectively. 


So when a series like Isekai Smartphone comes along and seemingly plays the isekai premise completely straight, I wasn’t going to welcome it with open arms. Still, it did have one unique hook, that of the protagonist bringing his smartphone into the fantasy with him. Perhaps, I thought naively, that would at least be interesting enough to hold my attention. 


The problems with Isekai Smartphone are myriad. The most glaring issue is its characters, or to be more specific, the lack of any compelling characters for the audience to get attached to. The worse offender of this is the protagonist, Touya. He greets every situation with a nonchalant cheerfulness, from his sudden death at the beginning of the series all the way to discovering an ancient floating sky garden. The only instances in which demonstrates any real emotion is the prospect of seeing his numerous harem members in underwear or any other skimpy clothing. Not helping his case is the appalling ease through which he overcomes challenges. Simply put, he starts off overpowered and ends the show even more overpowered. By the end of the show, he has crafted a working gun in a fantasy world, gained two high level spirits as familiars, has ownership of an ancient floating island and is effectively a de facto member of the royal family. This bleeds into many aspects of the show, reducing every fight scene to a boring wait for the protagonist to solve the problem with a single spell or previously inconceivable strategy. That being said, the sheer overpowered nature of the protagonist somehow manages to be entertaining rather than aggravating. The whole show is so light in tone that it’s impossible to truly get mad at it. 


The other characters, mainly comprised of Touya’s harem mates, don’t fair much better, rarely distinguishing themselves beyond their attraction to Touya and the diverse archetypes they represent. It says something about their lack of character that I can’t remember half their names even after twelve episodes with some of them. Wish fulfillment harem fantasies don’t work when the girls feel less like actual people and more like a creator went down a checklist of character templates to add. That by itself is not an inherently bad thing. Princess Principal, from the same season, also starred a group of standard character archetypes yet gave them real depth through backstory and developed relationships between them so that the audience could invest in them throughout the story. No such thing happens in Isekai Smartphone. 


Compounding the issues with character is the show’s story, which largely focuses on short vignettes rather than an overall arc. The slice-of-life approach can work if the characters and situations are sufficiency amusing, but save for the slime castle mission, most of them serve as means to give Touya even more abilities or harem antics that get repetitive fast. This is also a series that opts to tease future in lieu of any sort of climatic confrontation at the end of the series. Instead, the final “conflict” is whether Touya will agree to marry all the girls he’s accumulated throughout the series. Despite literally having God on his side and everyone in his harem being ok with polygamy, he refuses, citing his unwillingness to take such an “adult” responsibility. Given that at this point he’s escorted a diplomatic delegation, saved a village from a rampaging dragon, foiled an attempted assassination of the King and ended a war, this comes off as laughable. 


I haven’t even mentioned the smartphone itself because very little would change without its inclusion. Sure, it gains increased prominence and usage near the end, but considering it’s prominence in the title this was a seriously missed opportunity to distinguish this show from other run of the mill isekai shows. Later episodes do make better use of the smartphone, mainly in combination with Touya’s magic to resolve every bit of large scale combat off-screen. 


Isekai Smartphone, in summary, is an example of a show that does the bare minimum required. It’s worse sin is that it is merely boring without being infuriating. As such, it leaves very little impression in mind, even compared to its contemporaries. If you ever wanted to know why isekai anime are greeted with such trepidation these days, Isekai Smartphone neatly encapsulates every critique of the genre into a singular forgettable package.

For all the people out there complaining that this anime is "one of the worst" and 'it sucks", and other hateful things, you KNEW that this was a animated light novel adaption ( I don't consider them true anime) either keeping or adapting the popular "harem king" trope for the television ( or the internet, whichever way it gets on there). To say that it's lame just because it has a seeminly "god-like" MC who is essentially unbeatable is just stupid. It could have been HXDXD's first season (which  in reality sucked royally because Issei was just acting like a perv to basically hidehis lack of self-confidence and the fact that he's actually a pretty smart guy, with no explanation as to why or even how  he's pretending to be something he's not) or 11eyes (Not too bad but should have worked with the VN more.).


Comparing it to other anime and LN adaptions of similar genres and episode length this is actually more realistic in terms of character development and power gaining. It is a sad fact that in many modern anime the MC is so weak he can't do crap at the start, and as the series progresses he somehow gets abilities strong enough to wreck this planet many times over via a plot hole or filler. In Isekai wa Smartphone Touya may be a rip-off of the Avatar as well as an enhanced body but he had to put the pedal to the metal for all his other abilities and powers, even though he was chosen by God.


The other characters are properly described and their interactions fluid enough, which is a + for a industry overfilled with boobs, powers and ( sometimes ) gore. I also appreciated the fact that Production Reed decided to tone down on the ecchi while putting the LN on the big screen and focus on the story,which is good enough to keep you hooked as you go from episode to episode. 


The only issue with this LN adaption is, or was that now that it's finished is the fact that it should have been longer. The season finale just ends with the MC being polygamous and if you don't read the LN you won't have a clue as to what caused that to happen. That silver-haired, purple eyed dude from the opening should have received more than a cameo but like soo many other "anime" these days, this is just a proof of concept. 


Apart from that it's worth a watch if you're sick and tired of all the boobs and poorly done stories racking anime these days.

We have a lotta girls here, and they can all be considered as cliche characters, but the guy Toya Mochizuki, well he has everything, smarts, balls , luck, girls, everything a guy would wanna have, so in what area would a character like that go wrong??????Well, that's just it, nothing was wrong with that guy, since he can have anything, the original creator, Patora Fuyuhara was simply playing too safe with his character to the point of making this anime as boring as it can be, in fact the character itself can be consider as the creator himself who has such fantasy of being that character, that basically sicken me to the point of wanting to go to Japan , look for him and pour cold water on his head. In fact studio Production Reed made a bad bet when they choose this thing to have an anime adaption, they should have just comb more for other manga to have an anime adaption. [Mild spoilers ahead, be wary.]
First review. Let's see how this goes.
So, this show is basically if SAO and Konosuba had a baby, and the end result is a painfully mediocre harem anime. You know the plot, the main character Touya dies accidentally to God and offers him a second chance at life being born in another world and he chooses to keep his smartphone in that world. On top of that, he also receives a significant boost to all of his senses/abilities which basically makes him ridiculously OP. I have a number of problems with the show, but let's start with the object that's thegimmick of the whole show... The smartphone.


Throughout the entire show, the smartphone has had little to no practical use in the story. It's the one thing that makes this show different from any other Isekai anime, and the smartphone is completely null and void because Touya is a literal god. I won't spoil anything specific, but he can basically solve any problem the show throws at him with the lift of a finger; It's completely effortless and his plans work every time without fail because of his vast array of skills. That means every conflict in the show doesn't feel like there's any weight to it, even though the show tries to make you care and think that they might have a problem, because nothing can touch Touya and the problem is solved in a matter of minutes. It makes a lot of sequences feel empty and vapid with no substance to it. The smartphone being useless inherently presents us with these two problems: The one unique thing in the show being near pointless, and Touya having absurd Kirito-like power. It's not interesting and it's not compelling.


Speaking of Kirito-like power, I must emphasize this point about Touya as well. Once again, I won't spoil anything, but there are multiple times in the show where he's able to effortlessly do things that would normally be incredibly difficult for any other person to do... Time and time again. Yes, it makes sense in the context of the story since God boosted his powers but that does not excuse making him a flimsy and boring character.


Another big problem I have is that the pacing of the show feels rushed. The pacing is just rapid and leaves no room for you to immerse yourself in the scenery or even care about what's going on. It feels like the bare minimum is done for each scene and them immediately moves on to the next one. It's unfortunate, but it's like the show could care less about what's going on and is just going down the list of things that need to happen to move the story along. Little substance makes it very boring.


The tone of the show is actually something that I kinda liked. The whole feel of Smartphone feels very warm and friendly. For the characters, it's a casual little adventure while traveling across the land discovering new things. While that's all well and good, the aforementioned problem of the non-existent conflict along with mediocre writing don't make the show necessarily funny or enjoyable. I see the potential here, but it doesn't really hit it's mark.


Now for the characters. Most of them aren't very unique or interesting, but all the girls are at least fair and fit their role. Once again, it's Touya who brings it all down since he's a Gary Stu. However, I won't harp on him much more since you already know the problems with him. The girls unfortunately get little to no background or character, and that's a shame because unlike Touya, I feel they have the potential to be interesting and varied with their character. The show sadly doesn't like to add any depth to them, because they're introduced to Touya and they're instantly part of the harem with little insight on who they are and what their motives are. Their history, interests, choice of weaponry, personality... Absolutely none of it is explored so they too end up feeling hollow and fall in love with Touya for no good reason (Besides Yumina which is explained but it still feels a tad cheap).


The art is fine, for the most part. I really like the design of the girls in particular, but they were the only ones that really stood out. Everything else feels incredibly basic for a Fantasy world. Typical villages, kings, castles, fields, giant dragons, etc etc. You've seen it all before; nothing is unique but it's at least serviceable. Action scenes aren't very good, though.


Overall, I feel smartphone had some potential to be a good show, but had to go the SAO route and make an OP main character which automatically gets rid of any conflict or tension the show offers, along with a pace that moves way too quickly and you're given no time to care about any of the characters, nor do they get any depth because of it. You know a show is bad when the best part halfway through is a fanservice scene that's been teased since the beginning.
